text:
Dark brown to black in color, foamy beige head... Aroma of peated malts, caramel, smoke... Flavor of dark fruits, peat, caramel, toffee, light smoke, nuts... solid wee heavy 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank from a glass, poured from a bottle, 
this beer was dark brown in the glass, and gave a off-white / light tan cover of bubbles, it left nice spots and fingers of lacing on the glass, 

when I first popped the cap, I got a nice mix of caramel and chocolate mixed with big malty notes, 
it had aromas of dark and intense toasted malt, caramel, toffee, dark candy, a little horehound in the background, faint dark fruit (similar to raisin and date), 
faint earthy and smokey aromas on the nose, faint alcohol esters, and brown sugar sweetness, 

the flavors were malty, dark intense malt, caramel, dark candy, brown sugar, 
the finish had a bit of a alcohol spice bitterness to give some balance to the malt and sweetness, the malt layers and coats the tongue, 
faint chocolate in the background, caramel and dark candy hung around, 

this beer leaned towards the full side in the mouth, there was soft to average carbonation, and it was creamy and coated the mouth with each drink, 

the nose was great with a generous malt notes, the flavors were just as nice as the aromas, 
a very nice Scotch from AleSmith.

Bottle a black colored beer with a brown head aroma malts roasted malts caramel fruits dried fruits spicy and bitter hops flavor malts roasted malts caramel dried fruits dark fruits chocolate coffee and bitter hops

From a bomber. Pours a dark brown and makes a thin beige head. Not much lacing. I recommend letting this ale warm up a bit if you have it stored in a fridge. (I would cellar). Aroma is of caramel, toffee, brown sugar, and booze. Tastes of dark fruits (plum, raisin, currant), cherries, roasted malts, complex yeasts, and molasses. This is a beautiful interpretation of the scotch ale style. One of the best. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Sporo suszonych, ciemnych owoców, karmel, troche toffi, czekolady. Dymionych aromatów jest tutaj jak na lekarstwo. W smaku słodkie - poziom słodyczy raczej stabilny przez całą degustację. Wysoce pijalne, lekko ulepkowate, takie lekko śliwkowe rzekłbym. NIe zaskakuje, nie powala.
Beautiful scotch aroma. Nice rich head of small tan bubbles. I get lots of caramel, toffee and malt right away on the taste. Full, creamy texture. One of, if not the best Scotch Ale Ive had.

Tap at Rochester Tap House. Pours deep mahogany, beige head. Aroma is lots of caramel, fig, toffee plums, dark fruit, really nice nose. Flavor is caramel, fig, toffee, sweet dark fruit nose. Body is kinda nitro-ish. A bit thin. Nose is great.

Pours almost black with little to no head. Aroma of rich toffee, caramel, toast and treacle. Very faint hints of Christmas fruit, raisin and rum. The flavour is an impressively rich toffee explosion. This is seriously good beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark ruby brown color with a creamy light tan head. The aroma is sweet caramel, toffee, subtle raisin, and soft florals. Flavors are layers of smooth caramel, prune, and a dry toffee and smoke malt undertone.

The aroma is caramel, bread. Pours a dark amber brown, with virtually no head or lacing. The taste is sweet and bitter. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish long. Very Good!!

Appearance- very very dark brown, mahogany, a light brown head of around one finger. Aroma- cherry, liqueur chocolate, dark fruit, more cherry, malty brown bread, stewed dark fruit, vanilla traces. Taste- caramel, chocolate, dark toasty malt, almond, cherry skin, boozy dark fruit undertones, slightly burnt toast, raisins, treacle toffee. Full and sticky mouthfeel, chewy, with boozy warmth. Very good.
Aromas of sweet, dark fruits, even a touch of grapes and a hint of smoke. Flavor of smoke, peat, plum, with a mid-sweet malt body. Nice smooth body, mid level carbonation. Overall it pretty solid.

Bottle. Pours brown with small beige head. Aroma: sweet, slight sourish, raddish, caramel, toffee, smooth alcohol- nice. Taste: medium sweet, raddish, caramel, balancing sourness and bitterness, toffee, cloves. Full body. Well balanced. Nice.
Tap at gravity. Deep mahogany with small head. Raisin and dark fruit, finishing fairly dry. Ive never been a fan of this style, but this is excellent.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle - #1500! Pours a murky, rusty maroon color. Thin, wispy ivory colored head. It looks hearty. Aroma of ripened, dark fruit...fig, plum, raisin. Traces of caramel and sweet earth. Beautifully goes down the gullet, medium-full bodied with a slight bite of carbonation. Oak and scotch hit first, a little bit of smoke as it returns to the dark fruits, some cherry this time, notes of chocolate and toffee. Very well made, easy to drink for 10% too.

Flaska från Beergium, provning med ölsällskapet. Åtminstone ett år gammal. Mörkbrun/mahognybrun med beiget skum som lämnar lite rester längs kanterna. Stor, oerhört maltig doft med massor av kola, butterscotch, torkad frukt, kakao, choklad och lite inlagda körsbär/sherrry. Stor, fyllig kropp som sväller fint i munnen och samtidigt har ett lite torrare inslag. Stor maltsötma i smaken utan att det drar iväg. Muscovadosocker, bränt socker. Balanseras upp väl av lite rostade rågtoner, värmande alkohol och en något torrare avslutning som lyfter fram lätt rökiga toner. Ganska bitter i avslutningen med en del beska. Väl avvägd, komplex, snygg. Stilenlig Scotch Ale. Inget spexigt men ruskigt välgjort.

Bottle. Pours clear, dark amber in colour with small tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, dark malt, some toffee and chocolate and dried fruits. In taste similar, medium sweet, bit boozy too. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is quite dry, medium bitter and bit boozy. Really good, with mellowed alcohol would be great

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Starts off with a malty molasses, but then scotch and oak flavours come through, intermixed with currant and vegetal notes...fantastic.
Adjunct: Aroma is bourbon and scotch, with sweet malt and toffee; deep brownish amber with a two finger creamy, tan head, that reduces fairly quickly.

Poured from 750ml bottle. 

Nearly opaque, dark rusty brown with a small tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit, dark chocolate fudge and toffee. 

Taste of toffee, roasted malt, dark fruit, booze, caramel and fudge brownies. 

Full body and medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer is markedly better warm so do not drink it chilled otherwise the taste of alcohol is overwhelming.

Pours a dark brown, aroma of brownies, hops (floral/citrus), booze. Taste is similar sometimes tastes exactly like a brownie, other times like a boozy prune-like barleywine. Hops for balance, but bitterness is definitely present. More chocolate and brownie in the finish. Some breadcrust as well.
From tap at CBC 2016. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of caramel, oak, malt, dried fruit, smoke and alcohol.

n the glass it has a dark brown almost black with a crown of beige, creamy and lasting foam. In the nose hints of caramel, brown sugar, coffee, cocoa and floral notes and some applesauce appreciated. In the mouth it is sweet, it leaves much notice caramel, roasted notes and hints of cocoa are appreciated, alcohol is seen towards the end of the drink and has a medium body / integer and a medium carbonation

Bottle 
Aroma-caramel, fruits
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, lively, long finish, 
Overall-perfect

Vintage bottle of a few years old. Thick, dense, creamy, frothy, pale yellowish beige head over a very dark but still translucent burgundy brown beer with purplish hue. Aroma of stewed plums, caramel, baked banana, toffee, cocoa powder, port wine, mocha, pear syrup, dry tea leaves, hint of bayleaf, touch of onsetting oxidation. Soft fruity onset (hints of fig, raisin, blue plum) with a touch of blackberry sourishness and residual brown sugar sweetness, softish carbo; thick, fluffy, moelleux and full mouthfeel. Notably caramelly and toffeeish malt middle with ongoing brown sugar sweetness leading to a softly toasted bitterish ending with faint coffee-like features as well as a touch of herbal hop bitterness; oxidation is there and returns retronasally, but in this luscious environment, I cannot be bothered by it. This is a deliciously rich beer, Scotch indeed if you count in the roasted bitterish accent, but it remains a subtle addition, so that the whole feels more like a quadrupel than like a true wee heavy to me. Regardless, this is a beautiful sipper by all standards.

Kirkas, tummanruskea ja hyvin pienesti vaahtoava olut. Tuoksu paahteinen, karamellisen maltainen ja hennon kuivahedelmäinen sekä tamminen. Oikein nautinnollinen tuoksu. Maku tamminen, vaniljainen, makean karamellinen ja kuivahedelmäinen sekä hennon katkera. Täyteläinen suutuntuma, makea ja matalahiilihappoinen. Mausteisempi kuivattava ote loppupuolella tasapainottaa hyvin kokonaisuutta. Hienoinen alkoholisuus toimii tässä.
Draft at the source on 6/30/2016. Dark brown/mahogany with a light beige head. Aroma of malt, wood, caramel and booze. Taste is malt, toffee, caramel, oak, alcohol, and light smoke. Excellent.

On tap at brewpub. A clearish ruby reddish dark brown with a short lived beige head. Aroma is caramel, brown sugar and soap. Flavor is caramel, brown sugar, roast and ash. Finish is roast, burnt and sweet. Full body, slightly velvety mouthfeel and average carbonation.
Draft. Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are large caramel, toffee, and some dark fruits.

Bottle at Svijet piva (World of Beers), Zagreb. Shared with lovely Anja, Shotgun Fred and Marko. About a year ago. Black, small lasting tan head. Malty aroma, dry fruits. Bitter, but drinkable, dry. Alcohol present, dry finish. Not many notes on this one, shame.
Bottle. Brown-ruby color, creamy foam. Aroma: wine, special malt, caramel, fruit, dried fruit. Taste: wine and malt, dried fruit, alcohol, prunes, port wine, powerful, good.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Celebration 2016, Copenhagen - pours dark brown with a reddhish hue topped with a beige head. Rich sweet malty aroma and taste, some caramel, molasses, dried fruit, sweet finish.

Ooh yeah, now were talking. All the complexity and nuance of the other AleSmith brews that have recently made it to Texas but also featuring smoky, roasty notes. Delicious. Will definitely be stashing a couple of these away for a later date.

Murky brown color with tan head. Aroma has lots of dried dark fruit like raisins and dates. Taste follows with the dried fruits, brown sugar and caramel. Not overly sweet, easy drinking especially for the high ABV. Heavy body with sticky feel and medium carbonation. Really good scotch ale, one of the best I had.
Pours a dark cola color with a boozy malty aroma. Taste is a bit boozy with a sweet toffee flavor. A crisp dry beer with a bitter aftertaste. Dried candied fruit flavor throughout.
Pours dark chocolate with a light brown head. Smell and taste is burnt toffee. Taste is very boozy even though the alcohol content is lower.
Tap @ CBC16. Pours dark brown, reddish, with a medium brown head. Aroma is tannic, licorice, malts, caramel, dark fruits. Taste is nutty, licorice, caramel, toasted malts, boozy.

On tap at Alesmith brewpub. Dark copper brown with a ring of head. Sweet caramel aroma. Heavy sweet booze with lots of sweet bite! Hoo! This one aint light. Im not a big scotch ale wee heavy guy. Similar to Old Chub its strong, heavy and sweet. Really nice just not my style. Too bold and boozy for me.
Tap @CBC16. Clear brown, small beige bubbles. Malty aroma with light hops and honey. . Sweet, sticky flavour, malt and fruit. Hoppy bitterness and malty sourness.

Tap at CBC. Pours deep amber with thin tan head. Aroma: sweet, dried fruit, caramel. Intense, smooth, complex. Full bodied.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella del @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Gijón 16/04/2016.
Color marron oscuro, aromas caramelo, sabor dulce, notas tostadas, cuerpo alto.

Aromas a caramelo y frutos maduros
Buen aspecto y carbónatacion media-baja
En boca ciruelas, pasas y caramelo

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a thick brown color with a light brown creamy head. Notes of toffee, dried fruit, tootsie roll, and faint smoke.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 75cl bottle at home, bottled 02/20/2014. Very dark brown colour, light brown head. Rich dried fruits like figs and raisins in the nose, bitter dark chocolate edge too: taste is likewise, caramel/toffee sweet, spicy, liquorice, maybe a bit smokey, lingers beautifully fruity and sweet but cant really appreciate the bitterness. Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Draft. Pours deep mahogany with a beige head. Sweet bready and candy malts, light toasted malts, and low bitterness, with very little (relatively) residual sweetness. Quite good; very clean and easy drinking for the high ABV.

Dark nutty brown and very little of white head. Toffee, dates and raisins in the aroma. Very nice! The taste is very sweet. Tastes of dates and raisins and with a decent bitterness to balance. Really has all I love of this beer style.

Draft at the new brewery. Pours hazy nut brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like smooth booze, nutty malt, earthy, woody, toasted, and dried fruits. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like booze, nutty malt, earthy, woody, and some dried fruits.

On tap at Mohawk Bend in snifter. Aroma is moderately strong caramel and roasted malts. Appearance is dark brown mahogany, ring of off-white head with nice lacing. Taste is dark fruits and caramel--covers alcohol well. Palate is medium bodied with average texture, average to lively carbonation, finish is long lightly sweet fruit. Overall, a classic representative of the style.

750 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 with Gus and I. Thanks! The pour is a dark dark ruby color with a light khaki colored head and a little bit of bubbly lace that falls to a collar. The aroma is sweet malt and caramel. There is a hint of booziness and a light metallic note that kind of deter this from being incredible. Chocolate and caramel really bring it back together on the back end. The flavor is also pretty good. That metallic tendency just exists, and the malts are very good. It's got a sweetness and a lovely caramel note. It's really good, aside from the light metallic. The mouth feel is a little watery with a nice carbonation and a sweet malty finish. It's complex and sweet, but the metallic just brings it down a peg. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20 and Gus. Aroma is caramel, toffee, bread, sweet malt, just really good. Appearance is dark brown ruby, light light tan head. Taste is caramel, toffee, sweet malt, slight metallic, but other than that, everything I want in a Scotch Ale. Mouthfeel is medium body, soft carbonation, caramel aftertaste. Overall, this
has been a wonderful journey from my very first scotch ale, a Founders Dirty Bastard. This is a beer I never thought Id try. And now that I have, Im very happy.

15.01.2015-Flasche-0,75L.Mahagony-Körper mit hellbraunem feinporigem stabilem Schaum. Aroma fast reintönig Bitterschokolade. Antrunk Malz,Portwein, Schokolade, leichte Röstbittere. Gegen Ende leicht pfeffrig. Tolles Bier!

Type: 8-oz. draft
Glass: Clear snifter glass
From: AleSmith Brewing Tap Room in San Diego, Calif.
Price: $4.25
Purchased: Jan. 9, 2016
Consumed: Jan. 9, 2016
Misc.: N/A

Poured a dark mahogany color with two fingers of khaki tan, rocky head when I got it. Good spotty lacing on the sides of the glass. Good retention on the top all the way down. (Smell - 4.25)

Smelled boozy scotch caramel, toffee, dark fruits, plum and roasty nuts. (Smell - 3.75)

Tasted roasty malts, caramel, toffee, scotch notes, but not as pronounced as the nose, dark fruits and some dates. (Taste - 4.00)

Medium-to-full body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth finish. (Feel - 4.25)

This was a very good beer for the style. Would have it again for sure. (Overall - 4.00)

3.98 89 B+
Awesome beer..really smooth with beautiful scotch notes...lots of malt and smoke...fruit present and some hops...loved this beer...solid job alesmith!

While the year AleSmiths Wee Heavy helped to bring in was new, the beer itself was pretty old - well over a year of age. The year will inevitably prove to be just another shitty year. The beer was a thing of beauty. Dark brown pour with an impressive head for the booze and age. Aroma of toffee, dark fruit, toasted malt, and chocolate cake. Flavors of smoked malt, charred caramel, roasted grains, and cocoa. Surprisingly, some hop bitterness was preserved. Not surprisingly, the booze note was warm and robust. A hell of a beer to aid the transition into the new year.

750 ml bottle from craft beer cellar shared with dad A: caramel, licorice, red fruits, prunes app: reddish brown with small beige head t/p: full body with sweet and long finish. Soft carbonation. Close to sticky O: a really good scotch ale. Complex it gets even better when it warms. Glad I bought this beer of exception.

750ml bottle consumed in NYE. Darker ruby, nearly black. Strong consistent tannish head. Nose has scotch and peat present. Little bit of chocolate in there as well. Taste has similar elements leaning on a heavy dose of chocolate with a good alcohol warmth. Roasted notes and malty forward essence. Dark fruit like prunes chine through. Feels like the type of beer that would knock you out but Im a more than a wee bit of a fan.

Big bottle with commonmac. Dark brown with medium frothy white head. Malty and alcohol in the nose. Soft, heavy alcohol, malt, boozy. Creamy body. Chocolate, drying, heavy alcohol. Its more than a wee heavy.

Bottle.

A- Raisins, dark cherries, fruit cake, port wine, oak, toffee.

A- Dark mahogany color, dark liquid, beige head.

T- Oak, dark cherries, cola, medium bitterness, dark fruits, red wine.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- Vintage 5/2014. Two years of age was beautiful. Very complex body with so much going on. Hard to find anything wrong here. Delicious!

Rich and back-to-dark-purple in the glass. Aromas of raisins, dates, grape musts, syrup, pine. Full and even lush on the palate, with a long finish. Brings the saltiness out of cheese. Currants, raisins, figs, and totally delicious.

Aroma: caramel, bread, roasty, smoke, 
Appearance: ruby red, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent

Pours dark mahogny, dark brown with a two finger, beige head that leaves a lot of lacing. 

Nose: A sweet nose of caramel malt, brown sugar, toffee and molasses. Dark fruit, raisin, plum, vanilla, oak and honey. 
Taste: Soft, smooth taste of caramel malt, vanilla, candied sugar, honey, molasses, prune, raisin, tobacco and wood. So beatiful! 
Mouth: Very smooth, full body with a great texture! Soft, creamy and almoust perfect carbonation! The beer fills my mouth with pleasure and pure happiness! The ABV at 10% is very well hidden and is only there to bring all the flavours to the beer. 

This i so fantastic! I have found another favorite beer today. Alesmith (almoust) never dissapoints me despite my high expectations. Wee Heavy is another beer to add to this "must have" list! 

Ok. I admit it - Im a sucker for great Scotch Ale and this IS just that!

Good flavor, malty, kinda thick. ---Rated via BeerBuddy for iPhone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Kris Wines, Holloway. Brown pour with a beige head (soon goes). Aromas of sultanas, dates, toffee, sweet spice, raisin and caramel. Rich flavours of raisin, toffee, warm spice, lots of sweet dried fruit action. Rich, warming feel. Long smoky-sweet finish. Lovely stuff.

Pours a deep brown color with a khaki head. Caramel, toffee, chocolate, peat, raisin, molasses, smoke and roasty malt aroma. Caramel, chocolate, toffee, molasses, booze, smoke, raisin, leather, peat, wood, toast and roast malt flavors. Full body and moderate carbonation. Caramel, chocolate and molasses finish.

Aroma:

Roasted malts, chocolate, licorice, slightly sour dark fruits, 

Appearance:

Ruby/brown beer with a medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

 Sweet licorice and chocolate, slightly bitter and dry coffee.

750 ml bottle, bottled 20/2/2014. Pours dark maple brown with a reddish hint. low dark beige head. Musty aroma, evolved and somewhat oxydized, caramel and toffee notes. Medium body, a bit greasy, and oxydised flavour is just not working for me.

750 mL bottle. Deep chestnut brown pour, big frothy tan head with amazing retention and lace. Nose is big malts, raisins, candy sugar, pumpernickel bread, toffee. Mouth is medium bodied, creamy, sweet with a balancing bitterness that kicks in mid-range. Coffee, dried fruit, toasted bread, caramel, malty goodness. Very nice Wee Heavy. Slàinte, lad.

.75l bottle from Firmabier. Pours dark red with high tan head. Aroma is dark malts, fruits, raisin, bread, syrup. Flavor is dried fruits, warming alcohol, plums, caramel, bread, rye notes, fruits, some hops. Well balanced beer. Nice ammount of co2. Swell!

Butterscotch, toffee, dark malts, earth, dates, dried fruits, ethanol, a hint of smoke, and some ash define the aroma. The mouthfeel is solid, with a thick mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. The taste is malty bitter, with residual sugary sweetness and a boozy edge that helps bring out woody, malty flavors. Great beer.

Bottle. Murky dark brown pour with a thick tan head. Aroma is raisin, dates, chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate, dark fruit, very rich with low carbonation, a touch of coffee in the finish. Really nice.
Dark. Hello booze. Caramel. Woody. Quite strong. Not my thing. Tasted at Elijah Ps Monsters of Beer festival.

Backlog rating. Keg at BD Shoreditch, London. It pours a clean ruby / copper color with a medium beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lightly boozy, with notes of vanilla, milk chocolate and toffee. Taste has dried figs, orange marmalade, vanilla ice cream and milk chocolate. Medium to full bodied with soft to good carbonation. Overall, intense
Bottle from saveur biere, france. Almost black color, tanned head. Aroma has nice roasty notes, licorice, suryp. Smooth palate, licorice, wheaty bock notes.

Dark Brown. No light through. Head is medium size tan head. Aroma is medium sweetness, hint of plum like notes. Light sweetness light bitterness. Medium body. Very soft carbonation, dryness. Very smooth feel. A hint of salt in the taste.

750ml bottle. Poured a dark brown color, ruby notes to it, tan head. Aroma was sweet, smooth notes of butterscotch, toffee. Flavor was light vanilla, some light sweet malts. Light booze warms my insides as I consume it. Its a lot to take in, but its good.

Pint 9 shared poured a translucent dark brown color with tan head and kind of a slick lacing. The nose is huge sweet malts blended with toffee and dark fruits and what I perceived to be hints of dark chocolate. The flavor is incredible the alcohol burn through the nose with the dark fruits and toffee and sweet malts, this is blended so nice. Mild bitterness on the back end, this beer rocks its amazing.
Garnet pour, rich malty aroma and some peat smoke. Flavor is rich malty and decadent, toffee and light caramel. Wonderful mouth coating finish, a dream in the 750 ml bottle.

Small sample from bottle at camping ratebeer 14. Pours hazy brown with a small off-white head. Aroma has molasses, raisins, malts and quite some sweetness. Taste has some chocolate, malts, sugar and raisins. Medium body and soft carbo.

Bottle. Pours deep burgundy with a big foamy off white head. Aroma is of pine, hops, alcohol, and smoke. Taste is of pine, smoke, caramel, sugar, and very slight hops. Lingering taste of sugary tobacco. After a few sips, a fair amount of oak starts to come through. Has a nice warming booze bite. Mouthfeel is creamy and decently carbonated. Tasty, boozy, and easy to drink. Very good.

2015 750ml. bottle. Pours a deep brown red mahogany color with a nice thought foamy frothy khaki head that hangs around. Aroma has heavy burnt caramel toffee sugary nose slight spice a little wet tobacco. Taste is smooth caramel toffee malt roastiness and wet tobacco subtle brown sugar, raisin plum qualities. Nice! Very nice.

750ml bottle. Dark brown colour, beige foam head. Aroma of malt, toffee, caramel, dark fruit, roasted, woody, nutty. Taste is sweet malty, roasted note, bready, with caramel, toffee, brown sugar, dark fruits, raisins, nutty and earthy spicy grassy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, lingering malty finish. A perfect beer to end the evening!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
sample at mickeys. Strong and caramel. Lots of complex toasty, nougat, and caramel flavors. This is interesting and strong but the complexity has you going back for more.

DUft: karmel maltet sødlig vanilje 
smag: maltet karamel sødme rosin vanilje lidt rosin

BOD 2/11/14. Pours a clear rich mahogany. Normal head volume, lacing and retention.

Outstanding, but of moderate intensity, complex nose of caramel, dark fruit (fig, date, raisin, prune) and molasses with a touch of alcohol.

Light full body with an almost creamy texture. World class carbonation with a nice effervescent burst in the middle and a robust finely bubbled burst in the finish.

The outstanding flavor profile is reasonably intense, complex and well balanced. It doesnt quite cover the alcohol and lacks the robust flavor of the world class Scottish Ales. It begins with a wave of dark fruit - mostly prune, but raisin and fig are evident. Towards the middle tobacco is present as the malts begin to assert themselves. A moderate sweetness constitutes the middle as caramel and molasses. The heavy prune notes are always present, but are somewhat balanced in the middle. The finish is a slow fade of prune and molasses coupled with a bit of an alcohol bite. Dial the alcohol back a point or so and this could challenge for world class. The alcohol tends to overwhelm the rich flavors this ale has and results in the prune flavor dominance noted.

Embouteillée 29/10/2013, bue apres 22 mois. Robe brune orangée aux reflets rubis. Léger col de mousse. Dentelle epaisse et collante. Arômes de cassonade, sucre dorge, anis, raisins secs, baies confites, figues, pointes de café moka. En bouche, cassonade, sucre dorge, anis. Beaucoup de baies. Un sucre résiduel envoûtant. Une finale de chocolat au lait et legerement amère. Texture épaisse, corps dune rondeur superbe. Un pétillement faible qui permet dapprécier les différentes saveurs. Haut taux dalcool imperceptible.

Bottle 0.7l from Svijet piva in Zagreb. Hazy dark brown liquid with big beige head. Aroma of vanilla cake. Very sweet and a bit alcoholy but has very nice taste of vanilla and cake. Strong vanilla taste.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma is black cherries, vanilla, oak, dark fruit esters, and light chocolate. Flavor is rich and vinious with nice oak, and soft sweetness. Medium body.
Dark red garnet color white head white lacing. Pleated caramel and malt aroma. Flavor of light malted scotch with toffee background. Nice velvet smooth carbonation and mouthfeel.
Tasted at RBSCSG. Smell of dried fruits. Heavy, tarry taste, sweet syrupy notes. Slightly bitter finish.
A: Liqourice, dried fruits, some chocolate T: Taste follows nose. O: Rough and tough beer! Warming alcohol.

Chestnut brown color, average sized tan head. Chocolate and malty aroma. Very pleasant. Taste of chocolate, cake, brown sugar, some fruitiness. Full body, soft carbonation. Complex, smooth and pretty much awesome.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle @ Grand Tasting, RBSCSG 2015. Brown with a small tan head. MAlty and fruity tones. malt, fruit and bitterness. Full body with a long bitter / sour finish.

Clear dark brown color, big tan head. Aroma of chocolate, nicely balanced and full, some brown sugar, berries and roasted malt. Taste is chocolate, liquorice, cherry liquor, full body, thick and creamy texture, soft carbonation. Alcohol is bit noticeable. Nice cake/biscuit finish, reminded me of Kasteel Winter. Very very nice. //svijet piva
Bottle, sample @ RBScSG 15. Hazy dark brown head with a frothy head. Nose has dark dried fruits, figs and some malty sweetness. Taste is sweet, caramel, sweet malts and a lingering tartness.

Bottle at Voldby SPØ tasting. Dark colour and thin off white head. Aroma and taste of hard roasted malts, plum, prunes, caramel and dark sugar. A tiny touch of liquirice in the finish. Soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Powerfull scottish ale.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, caramel, dark fruits, toffee, brown sugar. Smooth mouthfeel. Oily texture. Soft carbonation.
Sample at RBScSG. Cloudy brown with off white head. Vinous and molasses in aroma. Vinous with fruit, dried fruit and syrup. Sweet with low bitterness and low carbonation.

Sampled at RBScSG-15
Brown with almost no head. 
Sweet and vinous aroma with molasses and dark toffee. 
Sweet in the flavour with dried fruits.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Taster at the brewery. Dark brown color with beige ring. Aroma is not too strong, mostly toffee. Taste is a complex nutty-earthy flavour explosion without being sweet-malty. Well-balanced, as always. Amazing take on the Scotch Ale style!

Scotch ales arent my thing but this was decent. Amber brown color with no head. Aroma is tons of nuts, light oxidized notes, and caramel. Taste is moderately sweet and a bit harsh but you really cant taste the 10%. Good beer.
Un capricho de cerveza. Tostada, con un aroma a caramelo muy equilibrado. Y con alcohol, como debe ser.

750ml bottle. Dark brown colour, beige foam head and aroma of malt, toffee, caramel, dark fruit, roasted, woody, nutty. Taste is sweet malty, roasted note, bready, with caramel, toffee, brown sugar, dark fruits, raisins, nutty and earthy spicy grassy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, lingering malty finish. Nicely drinkable.
Bomber to a tulip. Deep Amber brown with light tan head and loose lacing. Rich notes of fresh bread and toffee, spice, dark fruit. Smooth, flavorful, balanced. A delicious Scottish style ale.

25 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at ~45 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a deep, dark mahogany brown, and forms two fingers of pale tan head with fantastic retention. The head itself leaves almost sheetlike lacing on the glass as it recedes, and the rest of the lacing is appropriately thick as well.

Smell: Thick, heavy toffee and caramel, sweet and bready, rush out of the glass like kilt-clad highlanders in Pictish war paint howling a battle cry as they charge downhill, swords in hand. Theres a hint of some raisin in there as well, like the wrinkled old highlander marching behind them, playing the bagpipes, caring not that hes walking into a battlefield unarmed. Hes crazy, that raisin. Oh, and you can smell faint leather as well, which makes sense, because baldrics and boots and such. To battle!

Taste: That aforementioned toffee and caramel? It came to fight. Those are the first flavors that greet the tongue, the vanguard of the assault, before the rank and file troops hit as a wall of warm dark bread. Somewhere in the swirling chaos of malty melee, that raisin rings out, like strains of Scotland the Brave played within the roar of battle and the screams of the dying. As the beer moves along, tones of leather and damp, peaty earth appear, fitting for a field of war soaked in sweat and blood. The ABV also makes an appearance towards the finish, a sudden surge of heat as the victors set fire to the homes and lands of the fallen.

Mouthfeel: Thick, creamy, full, rich, and sticky, this latches on to ones teeth and does not let go easily.

Overall: Quite a good wee heavy, with intense malt flavors and just enough earthy bitter, and the mouthfeel and appearance one wants from this style nailed perfectly. The only complaints I have, if one can even call them that, is a relative paucity of dark fruit complexity (I get only raisin from this one), and some unconcealed heat from the ABV. Its still a heck of a wee heavy, and a heck of a beer!
Tap. Brown pour with a big white head. Caramel, oak. Medium body and carbonation. Really nice
Brown to black appearance with small head. Heavy matls, nuts, dark fruits, coffee on the aroma. Full bodied and sticky with medium sweet and salty taste.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2015 Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Very dark with an off white foam. Aromas are molasses with earthy peat and rich coffee. Nutty with marzipan alcohol and dark berries. Plummy with raisins and herbal liquorice. Flavours are sweet dark malts with dusty cocoa and black grape skin. Warming alcohol with marzipan and woody aspects. Raisins with dark toffee and leafy, herbal notes. Earthy on the finish with more underlying sweetness. Very good.
Bottle from BrewDog Liverpool. Aroma is christmas pudding, spices, and sweet malty caramel. Appearance is Deep dark ruby with off white head. Taste caramel sweet, plate is thick and creamy.

Bottle ages for 11 months. Poured clear deep mahogany, khaki head that settles to a thick ring. Nice lacing. Caramel, peat, roasted malt nose. Tons of molasses, caramel malt sweetness and more peaty richness on the tongue. Long malty finish that leaves sweet stickiness on your lips. This is a standout scotch ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle dated 12/20/14 poured into a tulip glass..burgundy pour with a fluffy off white head..aroma of dark fruits,malts,caramel..smooth,malty,dark fruit flavor..alcohol very well hidden..good stuff.

From a bomber in an English Pint glass. Aroma is light Scotch whiskey. Flavor is Slightly sweet, rich, scotch flavor, fruity. Clean finish. Not super complex, but tasty, and doesnt taste like 10% ABV.
Caramel, choko aroma, appear Dark Brown with a fine White head. Taste medium sweet. Full bodied and soft carbonation

Bottle @ home, aged 3 years. Pours a dark copper liquid and a fantastic, large and creamy tan head, layered with beige foam below. Good Lacing. Fruity, sweet and vinous aroma with plums, sweet cherries, dates, caramel, toffee and a hint of chocolate. Big mouth feel and smooth texture and warming smooth alcohol. The Sweet taste is vinous with raisins, plums, caramel, dark sugar, spices. Lingering white chocolate, nuttiness and spices.
Cest un peu la westlveteren en mode écossaise. Cest riche, toffee, chocolat, cassonade. Lamertume équilibre bien et rend ce char dassaud très buvable.
Big malt caramel toffee aroma. Dark red translucent pour. Nice head. Flavors of predominately dark fruit type of malt character. Some fruity esters but this one is all about the malt.

Clear dark brown body with a medium light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, toffee, dark fruit and some hoppiness. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter. Full body, long finish, oily texture. Lovely.

Shared with Hrabren, Habek and Anja T.! Someone else? Perhaps. This was what Id waited for most eagerly the entire day. Almost black body, off white head. Strong aroma, malty assault, raisins, vague caramel/chocolate. Light alcohol. Sweet strong taste too, raisins again, clean, full maltiness, not much bitterness. Not as complex as I wouldve preferred, but this is flawless. Not a 4.0+ beer for me, though I do respect it highly.
Keg at Brewdog Aberdeen. Pours dark ruby brown. Nose is sweet dark fruits, toffee,anise. Taste is prunes, sweet caramel and toffee, dried fruits,liquorice. Delicious.

750 ml. bottled February 11, 2014. Pour is deep chocolate brown with some red hues. Lasting film of creamy bubbles. Aroma is prune, caramel cola and booze. Tastes of prune, earthy leaf and wood, dark toffee, cocoa and cabernet. Medium-heavy body is slightly sticky but pretty drinkable. Low-medium carbonation is nice, but seems a bit hot with the abv for the style even after a year plus of bottle aging.

On tap at pizza port a while back. Fantastic malt scotch aroma. Not woody but defiantly scotch. Malt dominates, silky smooth some anise and does end with very slight oersted character. Perfect to style.

Barwa ciemna, brązowa. Piana Średnia, kremowa. Aromat palonego słodu, karmelowy i wyczuć można w nim orzechy. W smaku orzechowe, nuty palonych słodów, karmel. Bardzo treściwe, gęste - po nabraniu piwa do ust, sprawia wrażenie, że moża byłoby je gryźć. Wspaniałe.
Dark brown colour, no head. Aroma of catamel, liquirice, anise, moscavado sugar. Taste is medium sweet. Medium body, oily texture, no carbonation.

Dark in color with a one finger tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, bread, some hops and a hint of alcohol. Taste is roasted malt and sweet with the alcohol present. Not my type of beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Uber, Seattle. Darkest copper-brown. Small foam. Big, sweet, coppery, malty. Pretty damn nice for style. Very smooth and defined body, alc rise at finish. Metallic in a nice balance. Cherries, rosy malt. Lots of flavor. A very nice warming beer.

Looks..very dark ruby, med head.
Smells..sweet malts, boozy.. berry, some honey, sugar.
Tastes..boozy caramel, cherry/choc, smokey malty .. It is sensational.

Botella de 75 entre 3. Color cahoba oscuro. Espuma beige de poca formación y muy poco persistente. Aromas a chocolate, alcohol, madera humo, moscatel, ciruela soasas caramelo, alcohol, salsa de soja, especias. En boca textura aceitosa, y carbonatacion fina, bastante viva para el estilo. Los sabores acordes a los aromas con notas mas alcoholicas. El final alcohólico, maltoso, salsa de soja, cola, especiada y madera. Largo y sutil. El alcohol se nota. Esperaba algo mas.

75 cl bottled. Pours dark ruby rust with a pleasant beige head. Aroma: Hay, pleasant chocolate biscuits, hops, licorice. Some background alcohol, liquor. Malty, toffee, even bread notes. Taste: Sweet, malty flavours. Herbal hops. Raisins, canned plums? Lots of flavours. Nice. Some bitterness with sweetness, yet quite sweet overall with slight tones of alcohol. Herbal feel. Palate: Full body, some carbonation. Hints of berry sweetness in the end. Pleasant malty aftertaste with some traces of herbs such as licorice. Even strawberries. Overall: Not a particularly big fan of this style, but this most certainly offers a lot of taste and flavour, lacks a bit balance. Glad I tried it.

Pours opaque coffee brown with light tan head. Roast malt aroma has molasses overtone. Flavor has molasses, licorice and roast malt notes, a bit on the sweet side. Firm texture has OK fizz and leaves a chocolaty finish.

Draft at 2014 Yokohama Beer Fest. Nice deep mahogany color with a thin off-white head. Lots of prune, currant, fig, brown sugar, vanilla chocolate and malt on the nose. Taste is more of the same, with a little of the alcohol peeking out as it comes to room temperature. Really, really smooth...like a great brandy. Full bodied with a thick texture. Nice smooth long finish.

Keg at Brewdog, Shepherds Bush, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a thin off white/beige head on top. Rich, boozy, roasty, malty, caramel aroma. Tastes similar, rich, boozy, dark fruit, caramel, slight sweetness. A damn fine Scotch ale from Alesmith.

Big Bottle picked up in Wisconsin. Pours a deep dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, dark fruit, molasses and had a hint of smoke. Flavor was quite sweet with caramel, dried dark fruit, toffee, toasted malts, molasses and had some notes of chocolate. Full body, creamy texture, medium carbonation.
Pruney and raisiny, with sweet, smoky maltiness permeating. Smooth on the palate but a bit fruit dominant, with subdued hops creeping in late and some heat showing through the finish. Aggressive.

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a creamy offwhite head, heavy lacings. Aroma of malt, caramel, nuts, little chocolate, some sweet dark fruit notes. Flavor is rather sweet, malty, caramel, brown sugar, chocolate, little spicy, earth, nuts, sweet dark dried fruit, raisin, plum, some alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, light warming alcohol. 200215

Red brown black colour, white head. Aroma of caramel, malts and chocolate. Sweet flavour, malts, caramel. Sweet finish, chocolate, caramel and malts.(from 75cL bottle @ Camping RateBeers. Thanks for sharing todays beers, RateBeer crew!)

Scored a bottle a little over 1 year old at friar tuck Peoria. Aroma is malty and boozy with dark plum and fig. I am also getting some black cherry and caramelized sugar. Pours a dark reddish brown with a tiny tan head. Taste is malty and sweet with a tinge of oak and sourness. Complex, roasty and smoky for a scotch ale. It even has that hint of booze burn that I like in this style. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(750ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Feb 6 2015) Pours very deep clear reddish brown with a small lingering bubbly off white head. Aroma nice and malty and toasted as well, sweet caramel molasses with a bit of raisin, lightly chocolatey, prune maybe, a little nutty note and wisp of smoke. Flavour of molasses and brown sugar, unsweetened cacao, toast, a mix of dried dark fruit, all kind of clinging to the roof of the mouth. Sweet at the beginning but becoming dry, mineral with a light toast bitterness. Aftertaste has some grain and lingering malt and dark fruit. Very light alcohol heat. The palate is almost watery and refreshing but with good flavour concentration. Light carb. Drinks so easily but elegantly. Great beer.

(bottle - 750 ml - 2010 vintage) Copper pour with a thin tan head. Heavy malt and caramel aroma with some chocolate underneath it. Slightly tangy at the start but then you get punched with a ton of malts. Some raisins and fruit flavors come through at the end. Really easy to drink.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Haze dark brown. Small head. Caramalty notes. Sweet raisins. Rum. Good body. Smooth. No hop feelings at all. Served cooled. Warming up. More complexity. Some staleness and oak mouthfeel. Fine brew v

I let this one age. > 4 years old. A very impressive beer. An amazing mellowness. The alcohol flavor expected is fully warmed down into a delicious cherry-ness. Very obviously aged as much as is an awesome beer underneath. I bet this is great fresh, but really happy I tucked this bottle away.

Not my favorite style, but this isnt a bad beer. Pours a dark copper with massive, quickly-dissipating head. Aroma of coffee, caramel, dark fruit. Flavor is sweet, but not sickly-so. Chocolate, coffee, licorice, toffee, and raisin/prune. Creamy mouthfeel. Some booziness, but not too pronounced.
one of the best beers i had. i love scotch ales and this one really delivers with aroma, taste and richness. speechless.
Tap at Brewdog Glasgow takeover. Chocolate. Bit of caramel. Feels bit too boozy. Nice though. Should probably try again.

0,75L bottle at the overpriced beer tasting, thanks for sharing guys! Pours dark brown with light brown head. The head stay for some moments. Aroma is malt, dark chocolate, fruits. Flavor is very sweet, malty, caramel, raisins, some alcohol. Overall: great brew.

Keg at Brewdog. Waited for this one to warm up. Very dark brown, pretty much black, creamy head with full lacing. Aroma is perfumey, sweet malt, musty leaves. Body is medium, smooth, rounded mouthfeel, low carbonation. Taste is old ale, malt-forward, sweet and yeasty, almost oxidised, tangy alcohol. Very slow drinker. Too sweet. Not my sort of thing really.

Overpriced Beer Tasting 2014. Dark reddish brown beer, frothy beige head. Nose is raisins, dried fruit, chocolate, malt, dense caramel. Flavor is licorice hints, fruit, bread, malt, sweetness, caramel, mild yeast. Finish is hops and caramel. Love the balance of sweet and not-so-sweet.

Pours amber with a small white head. Aroma is sweet and full. Grains, malt and brown sugar. Taste is strong and complex. Some nuts and malt and alcohol. Palate is thin. Overall I think its too strong, not very drinkable.
dark red slightly unclear beer with a good tan head. Smells malts, coffee and rye. Tastes great lije barley wine.. Average carbo, full body and a sticky texture

Bottle with Ben all those years ago then again courtesy of Ben at Beergeek bar in Edinburgh some nights ago. Cheers Ben. Pours deep Brown with a Tan head. Aroma has notes of raisiny sweetness and unashamed malty caramel. Malt versus Hops feels a lot like bass versus treble. Everyone goes on about The Bass but you cant beat a good bit of treble. This is a tour de force of malt. Dried fruit sweetness, warming booze and a bit of woody vanilla. Crank up the treble..

2011 Bottle. Pour is dark brown with some red tinting and a very small off-white head. Aroma and flavor of light caramel, smoke, peat, toffee, slight vanilla bean, and rye spice. Finish is sweet and boozy.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 Plummy and candied fruit all the way, this beer is sugary. Pours a dark brown liquid into the glass underneith a beautiful brown sugar-ish head. Ruby red flares are making their way through the beer. Aroma is malty, a lot of sugar, plum, raisins and alcohool as the liquid gets warmer. Tasting is not of a surprise: lot of malts, toffee and a little bit of smoke. Reminds me kind of a quad but with a more intense palate. I first loved it accompaning my chili con carne, but without food, this one was way to sugary. I didnt crush on this one.

750ml bottle @Overpriced Beer Tasting. Very dark brown color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Malty, caramel, roast, faint nutty, spicy hops, nettles in aroma. Mild roast, caramel, sweet, candy in taste. Caramel in aftertaste. No carbonation. Nice and mellow. More!
750cl. First aroma is of kali. After you get coffee and toffee. Sweet and thick. Pleasant texture. Pleasant carbonation. Charcoal, alcohol and caramel.
On tap at TJs. Pours dark reddish brown with tan head. Caramel, bread, plum, smoke, alcohol. High sweetness, low bitterness. Full, creamy body. Another fine AleSmith beer.

750ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark red brown color with dark beige head. Malty aroma, dark fruits, caramel. Sweet taste malty caramel,, butter, light fruity. Medium to full body, oily with soft carbonation.

Botella de 75 cl en el momento en el lúpulo el 12-12-2014. Embotellada en 15-01-2014. color oscuro con espuma beige y poca retención. Aromas y sabores escoceses total con un cuerpo medio a alto y buena sensación alcohólica y además cierta densidad, cada vez más apreciable según va calentando,, lo mejor esta al final. Bastante buena y con un final amargo intenso, seco y duradero.

A portion of the large bottle served in a Belgian snifter. 
Pours with a dark, hazy, red-brown body. Excellent sweet aroma and flavor. Faint dark fruits and compatible alcohol esters. Smoot body with low carbonation.

750 ml bottle. Deep dark reddish brown coplour, thick tan head. Aroma of wesst dark fruits, with notes of cocoa, wood and toasted malt. The flavour is caramel-sweet, with dark fruits, toasted malt, woody and smoky notes and a warm finish of dried fruits. Delicious.

November 7, 2014. Bottle. Pours dark brown with a dense , asting, off-white head. Aroma is licorice, caramel, notes of dried fruits, chocolate and smoke. Taste is medium sweet malty and dried fruits, light to medium bitter with a some peat notes in the finish. Medium bodied, quite fizzy carbonation.
bottle 2009-2010?? definately aged. smooth amber purple pour. sweet malts, some dark fruits, caramel, molasses. full creamy mouthfeel. Nice beer

Bottle. The pour is a rich copper color. The aroma is all molasses, big. The taste is mostly molasses as well, some toffee, a little too sweet for me, but solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at their tasting room. Pours a dark amber to brown. Thin tan head. Aroma is plums. Flavor follows. Very sweet. Dark fruits. Found and raisins. Smooth. Really nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kindly shared by Jaghana. 
Couleur noire avec reflets ambrées, très légère mousse. Nez fort et intense chocolat noir, reglisse, bon alcool. Super gout intense, cremeux, rond en bouche de prune, fruits noirs, malté, chocolat.... note réglisse, café, boisée barrique. caramel brulé et dense, bon alcool, fruits secs, raisins secs. Super complexe, légère et ronde en bouche, on peu la deguster pendant des heures. Super balancée. Une petite bombe!
Thanks a lot Jaghana!

Bottle 75cl, a dark beer with medium off white head. Nose is on prune, chocolate and peated touch. Aroma is on chocolate, dark coffee, quetsche and prune notes, oak notes, light peated touch, very creamy and smooth, robust body, dark chocolate, extremely complex with excellent texture. alcohol notes, tobacco notes. Finish is on peated notes with dark caramel, peppery hops, dark chocolate, plum, beer as a dream.

It pours dark with a plum hue when the light penetrates it. It has a healthy brown head. It has aromas of molasses, dark fruits, a bit of chocolate, and roasted elements. The first thing that hit me were the smoky flavors mixed with chocolate. There are also hints of dried fruits in the plum range with substantial warming on the way down. This one was saved for a special day and it was well worth the wait.

Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a dark brown color with orange highlights and a small foamy beige head that left good lacing. The aroma was woody, nutty, a bit toasty and had vague dark fruits and cola. The flavor was woody, nutty, toasty, a bit smoky and had notes of cola, fig, cherry and a boozy presence. Long finish with lingering booziness. Moderately full bodied. The booziness detracts from this one. Interesting.

Aroma: caramel, overripe fruit, toffee, some alcohol, prunes. Appearance: hazy, dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: malty sweets intensify, heavy caramel malts, grain and bread coming up, ripe, dark fruits. Overall: fantastic Scotch Ale, incredible complexity in all aspects. Pint at AleSmith Brewing Company, San Diego.

Big bottle. Poured a black color with frothy head. Aroma of molasses, cocoa, brown sugar. Taste is creamy and smooth. Slight warming alcohol finish. Medium heavy body. A real
Solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Pours almost black, nose is peat, caramel, berries, dark fruit, taste is dry toffee, rich caramel, fruity, peat.

A dark brown beer with a dense, medium and beige head. The nose is rich and it has strong dried fruits, raisins and dates, berries, strawberries, madeira wine, some alcohol and cold peppermint, hint of roastiness. Very complex aroma that is fresh despites of the richness. Taste has rich maltyness, dried fruits, raisins, strawberries, some dryer roastiness and bread. Medium bitterness dries the taste nicely. No alcohol. Almost full bodied, some carbonation, not too heavy. A very complex and rich flavours, powerfull, fresh anyway.

30/VIII/14 - 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) if I remember correctly, been in my beer fridge for a while @ Cybus veggie burger cook-off, paired with my wifes caramel pecan pie - BB: n/a (2014-959) 
Little cloudy red brown to purple beer, small beige creamy head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of caramel, ripe banana, sweet, little oxidized, dried fruits. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet start, caramel, some banana, bi tof dark chocolate, soft sour notes. Aftertaste: mocha, roasted stuff, caramel, cocoa powder, soft bitterness, overripe banana, bitter chocolate.

Bottle, shared by a kind soul, in a location remote of my dining room. 
Pours a dark brown with a small head and some lacing on the glass.

The aroma is lightly boozy with a big rich malt character, some light roast, and some mild toffee with a bit of cherry in there.

The flavor is pleasantly sweet with a light smokiness. Its got a lot of chocolate malty character to it. Its really rich and fairly restrained on the booziness, which is not to say that that particular aspect doesnt lend to a nice warming bit that fits the beer nicely. 

Its a style I normally dont get too excited over... many of them are awfully smoky, or worse over run with caramel malt sweetness. 
This one absolutely skips on both of those fronts, and lifts, really hard.
Another perfect brew from one of best breweries around. Dark in color and nice tan head. Smells of molasses and peated malt. Taste rich rasin plum, with peated smoke finish. AA++++++

UPDATED: APR 21, 2015 Bottle (12oz $12): pours very dark brown. Big tan head. Medium carbonation. Toffee. Carmel. Sticky. Very tasty. Bottle was 9 months old.
Updated: was 4.3, now 4.2

Very dark brown/amber color. Dense head. Aroma is pure malt, loads of toffee, caramel, cream. Very smooth on the tongue, heavy body though. Well made, very well balanced, huge on the tongue. Good for the style. A bottle to share.

Bottle from Jane?s Beer Store, in Mountain View. Aroma of toffee, dark fruit, some bourbon and booze. Pours clear dark brown with tan lacing. Big toffee and caramel taste, dark fruit, vanilla, sweet with a clean finish. Full smooth body.
Rather boozy, but good. Deep copper colour, slightest fizz. Mostly malty flavour. Nice.

Bottle. Dark Brown Body with tan head. Aroma is malt sweetnes with dried fruits and caramell with hints of coffee. Taste is caramell, toffee, roasted malts and hints of coffee. Aftertaste is medium bitter with caramell and malt sweetness. Nice one.

June 16, 2014. 750mL bottle from SF. Deep cherry red, almost black. Off-white head. Toffee, caramel, hint of ripe cherries in nose. Lovely smooth mouthfeel. Hints of roasted malts, dominant caramel and toffee flavours. Bit of a medicinal note that I find detracts from the overall flavour. Hint of smoke. As I was drinking this, the medicinal note started to turn my stomach. Too many terrible cough syrups as a child perhaps. :)
Bottle at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated 17082012. Colour is dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, grain, coffee, sweetness and malts.

Une mousse assez généreuse se crée lors du versement de cette bière dune couleur brune et assez opaque. Céréales un peu brûlées, noisettes et sucre brun sont les arômes détectés par mon pif. En bouche, je suis immédiatement saisi par la texture ronde et soyeuse de cette bière. Cest terrible comment cette bière se boit bien malgré son taux dalcool élevé. Les noisettes sont toujours là, des fruits confits samènent et le malt rôti est bien présent également. Dans le genre, cest assez dur à battre.

750mL Champagne bottle Bottled 1/15/14
Deep burnish bronze beer, nice bright edges. A dense half-inch of light tan foam sits proudly atop for the duration of the tasting.
Nose is rich, deeply complex & layered; treacle, Speyside singlemalt, toffee, cocoa, butterscotch, floral heather, dried fruits, faint peaty earthiness. 
Substantially thick, chewy, sticky, LONG on the palate, subdued creamy carbonation.
All emcompasiing sweetness upfront on the palate - lots of burnt caramel, treacle, golden syrup & butter on toasted crumpets, leading into dark chocolate, dark plums, dried fruits of sultana and date, and continues to more earthy notes of mild peat smoke, leafy hops & woody spice, finally ending with a lingering grippy bitterness and Whisky-like boozy embrace.
Rarely do beers seriously take me away to somewhere else, but I am very taken by this - seems so perfectly attuned for the style to the point where the idea of style is thrown out the window and one can become almost poetic with their evaluation. Needless to say, sensational!
carried over from untapped to try and organize my beers in one spot for synchronicity.

Butelka 75cl. 
OCZY : piwo ma kolor ciemnobrązowy z odcieniami wiśni. Ale z daleka wydaje się po prostu czarne. Piana piwa ma kolor ciemnego beżu. Nie jest wielka, całkiem zbita. Po czasie kompletnie znika zostawiając pierścień i lacing. 

NOS : po chwilowym odstaniu piwo na pierwszy niuch emanuje silnym aromatem toffi, suszonych śliwek, czekolady, banana, delikatnie kawy i alkoholu. To co się dzieje z nim po wstrząśnięciu jest niesamowite. Na wierzch wychodzą świeże aromaty gumy balonowej o wielu rożnych smakach, miedzy innymi truskawka, wiśnia, rodzynki. Natomiast cala reszta intensywnieje i świetnie współgra. 

USTA : piwo jest geste i oleiste. Ma konsystencje soku bananowego i niewielkie nasycenie. 
Piwo jest słodkie i rozgrzewające. Wyraźne nuty słodowe to przede wszystkim intensywne ciacho czekoladowe z toffi i rodzynkami popijane kieliszeczkiem starego porto. Do tego delikatne nuty palone osadzają się głęboko w przełyku, razem z rozgrzewającym alkoholem tworzy się prawdziwa poezja smaku. No ładnie. Chyba jestem pod sporym wrażeniem. Gorzkość jest delikatna a posmak przypomina suszone śliwki i porto. 

ODCZUCIA : piłem już kilka dobrych ejli w tym stylu ale bez dwóch zdań to wybiega daleko na przód. Tak jak nigdy nie bylem pod wrażeniem tego stylu tutaj można spokojnie się zastanowić nad tym jak ten styl w dobrym wydaniu pełni funkcje pomostu miedzy belgijskim quadem a amerykańskim RISem. Pycha. 

OCENA :
smak : 9/10
pijalność : deserowa
styl : +2

Dark mahogany pour with an off-white head. Aromas of smokey peat, caramel, toffee, some subtle dark fruit notes, and brown sugar. Flavor is sweet and smokey malts with notes of toffee and molasses. Really great beer, very complex. Abv is well-hidden also.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede bruine kraag. Ruikt koffie, vanille. Smaakt vol, vanille, koffie, crème.
Pours a dark red slightly unclear beer with a good tan head. Smells malts, coffee and rye. Tastes the same. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2014 750 ml bottle into snifter; no bottle dating, but has a store price tag dated 11/2/2012. Pours nearly opaque dark brown color with a 1-2 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big raisin, prune, fig, cherry, caramel, toffee, toast, molasses, brown bread, nuttiness, chocolate, cocoa, light smoke, leather, tobacco, herbal, and toast/yeast earthiness. Incredible complexity and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and fruity yeast ester notes; with great strength. Taste of big raisin, prune, fig, cherry, caramel, toffee, toast, molasses, brown bread, chocolate, cocoa, smoke, leather, tobacco, herbal, and roast/yeast earthiness. Minimal earthy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin, prune, fig, cherry, caramel, toffee, toast, molasses, brown bread, chocolate, cocoa, smoke, leather, tobacco, herbal, and roast/yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and robustness of dark/roast/bready malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester flavors; with an awesome malt/yeast balance and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and very full bodied; with a smooth, creamy, and moderately slick/bready mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible Scotch ale! All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and moderate fruity yeast ester flavors; and extremely smooth to sip on for the big ABV. An extremely amazing offering.

Bottle shared with friends after the 4th. Snifters. Pours a dark brown with a thick off-white head. Aroma is fruity (plums, raisins, over-ripe apricots), bread, doughnut, dark sugars, molasses, and spices. The taste was similar with the fruits and spices pairing well with the alcohol finish. Full body, oily and creamy texture. Light carbonation. Really a full flavored, fresh Wee Heavy. Lots of barrel as well.

Smooth bodied Scotch Style Ale with a mild aroma and a very full bodied head

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Frenchmans Cap with James and James. A dark ruby red colour with a foamy tan head. Aroma is dense malty, shortbread, fruitcake, caramel, spicy and alcohol. The flavour is caramel malts, dried fruit, brandy, cocoa, plummy. Wonderful.

Bottle shared at Manny Gs - thanks to Paul. Around 3-4 years old. Pours deep amber with a frothy beige head. Some old, rotting wooding the nose, leathery fruits, jammy berries. Medium to big sweet flavor, lots of rich bread, dates, a bit of old toffee, raspberry jam. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming to finish, fruitcake, more jam, raspberry, toffee. Great stuff. Touches of age at the edges but nice complexity overall.
Cloudy red brown. Nose is light smoke, toffee. Sweet, with some burnt caramel and light smoke. Full bodied, almost chewy. Good scotch ale.

Pours a deep, hazy, dark brown amber with light just making it through the edges. Nice light beige head and lots of fine lacing. Aroma is mild with toffee notes. Palate is full and smooth, great feel. Taste is delicious; caramel, toffee, burnt sugar, and finally raisins or some fruity flavor I cant quite pin down. Excellent beer.

750ml bottle - pours a dark mahogany with dark tan head . Intense dark fruit aromas with some floral hop notes . Taste is a wonderful blend of toffee , burnt sugar with a smooth palette . Finishes with a touch of smoke . Freaking delicious . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Starts out smooth and ends with a great flavor. Very full beer that smells just as good as it tastes.

750 mL bottle, in trade with treebute. Pours dark brown, with a small, beige head. The aroma is strong black bread, caramel, peat, light smoke, oak, and vanilla. Very sweet and malty flavor, with no perceptible bitterness or sourness. Very heavy body, thick, malty, and lightly astringent. Overall, this is a wonderful malt bomb.

Very dark pour with almost no head. Smoky and roasted aroma. Burnt sugar and bitter chocolate. Fantastic roasted malty flavors. Coffee, dark bitter chocolate. Nice alcoholic warmth while going down. Fat body with surprisingly more carbonation than expected. Absolutely an amazing brew! So very happy with this one!

Bottle shared with Simonsen
Dark brown, big creamy tanned head. Smell of dark malts, hints of caramel and toffee, hints of toast, some discrete chocolate flavors in the back. Heavy sweet, alot of dark fruits, dark sinful malts, caramel and a touch of toast. The texture is super oily and makes it even better. A wonderful beer!
On tap at Ruckus Morrisville. Roasted as heck - big malty backbone. More than a "wee" heavy.

Pours a dark brown-black with a one finger tan head with nice lacing. Aroma is of caramel, toffee, brown sugar, light smoke, coffee, coco, vanilla, and some raisins. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma. Has a medium-full body with a creamy mouthfeel and a mostly sweet, medium-long finish. Overall, a very tasty wee heavy that hides it 10% abv very well.
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. rather sweet

750ml bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo.16-04-2014.
In short: a nice malty ale.
Pours dark mahogany, hazy, with amber reflections. Malty, liquorice, butterscotch aromas. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste follows the nose. Quite enjoyable.
@zebf 2014 - Hazy dark brown colour. Aroma and flavour are typically sweet and malty. Its a good Scotch but maybe too much alcohol.

At Zeebra Beer Festival, THX to everybody sharing todays beers.
APPEARANCE: clear very dark blond too amber beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: caramel, some alcohol.
TASTE: caramel, sweet, alcohol, nothing special.
Nice aroma, but the taste wasnt very interesting. Standard scotch ale, has no special twist or extra depth. Just a regular example of the style. Decent.

Bottle @ Theis. Pours clear red/brown chestnut with a lasting and lacing small frothy beige head. Aroma is fruity, estery, caramel, quite hoppy considering the age, mild papery oxidized, vanilla, toasted malt. Taste is moderate sweet and light+ bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Finishes sweet, malty and warming.
Dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of plums red berries, chocolate, alcohol. Fruity taste with chocolate, candies, red berries, plums, sweet molasses, nuts, licorice. Tasty.

750 ml bottle, side-by-side with BA Wee Heavy and Backwoods Bastard awhile ago. From notes. Pours burnt ruby with khaki head and nice retention. Aroma brings some roasted/toasty malts, along with dark fruit and vanilla. Some caramel initially that grows in intensity as it warms. Theres quite a bit of alcohol in both the nose and the mouth -- some alcohol burn. After sipping on the BA version the toasted notes come through more strongly in comparison. Palate: Medium body, damned smooth, slick and syrupy texture, average carbonation. Overall: Early on (0-4 oz) this ran neck and neck with the other two. BA Wee Heavy eventually pulled away, but this was a clear second, and at 1/3 the price a bargain.
Flaske delt med esp0r. Mørk karamellfarge, lite karbonert, liten skumrand.smaker karamell, eik, vanilje,tørket frukt. En øl som varmer godt med sine 10 %. Veldig god

Dark ruby color, little lace of foam.
Aromas of raisins, plums and caramel.
Flavors of raisins, plums, butterscotch, dates and figs.

Couleur rubis foncée, belle dentelle de mousse.
Nez de raisins, prunes, caramel et boisé.
Saveurs raisins, prunes, caramel écossais, dattes et figues.

Bottle from Beers Of Europe. Poured a clear dark amber with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is big fruit, roasted malt, alcohol. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a rich red berry fruit, yeast, caramel malt, boozy alcohol light spice palate and a long bitter finish. Medium to full bodied with with fizzy carbonation and a lovely smooth bubbly mouthfeel. Considering the ABV the alcohol is well controlled. There is no alcohol burn, just a nice heart warming finish.

At a tasting, many many thanks yk23 and eyes_wide_shut, bubbly light brown head, dark brown colour, aroma of fresh chopped wood, caramel, sugar cane, dark bread and some spiciness, vinous flavour with dark sourdough bread, dried fruits and cocoa, amazingly smooth and silky and alltough very rich, really easy to drink..Wonderfull.
What a beer. Not overwhelmingly malty, a little chocolatey, a touch smokey, wonderful full mouthfeel, not only a great scotch ale but one of the best beers Ive had, period.

A- Pours a deep ruddy brown hue with a gigantic, chunky head.

S- Sweet, grape, vinous notes, hints of brown sugar

T- Dark fruit, slight coffee notes, hints of grape.

M- Thick with medium carbonation.

D- Extremely drinkable. I liked this one more than the BA version even though it was more tame.

Flaska från SB drygt två år gammal drucken med ölföreningen. Stora, söta och komplexa dofter och smaker. Choklad, sötlakrits, pastill, läkerol, kanderat socker, tjock kolakräm, mandel, blandade nötter, kryddig likör och molass. Söt inledning men lite torrare avslutning. Riktigt gott.
Ölföreningen. Smak och doft av häxvrål, choklad, hallon, sötlaktris, honung, bränt socker, sirap med toner av fikon och russin. Stor sötma, välbalanserad.

Bottle to giant snifter. Sweet malty aroma with very evident alcohol on the nose. Deep ruby brown with a beautiful bright red highlight in the sun. Tastes malty and sweet with a hint of rich darkness and less booziness than the aroma predicted. Smooth carbonation with just a little bite.

Year old bottle.


Look: Dark, golden pour with huge, thick (small bubbles at start), creamy, light mocha head. Has medium speed retention (small bubbles breaking down into bigger ones and then collapsing), goes down with some sticky lacing, leaves creamy, puffy top layer. The layer leaves some fine lacing when you drink it. Its clear, deep, dark amber, can barley see through. 


Smell: Rich yet smooth and fresh. First association are raisins in sugary scotch. The fruity part is mostly dark fruits, white grapes, plums and some dry fruits like raisins. It creates most of the fresh part. Malt character is also very well developed - burned and brown sugar, honey, molasses, light smoke, milk chocolate and roast. Nothing spikes out, its smooth and pleasant. Also some oak and earthy notes to play with the present alcohol, scotch notes. Alcohol/fusel is noticeable, but suits the overall complexity and is not distracting.


Taste: Medium heavy molasses, honey, caramel, chocolate start, continues the same path to full-on molasses with smoke (ash; stronger than in smell) and roast sweetness. Dark, dry fruits, raisins with scotch/rum stick around. Ends with light alcohol/stronger scotch and medium sweetness - that creates medium bitterness with light sour. Also some oak comes out in the after-taste. Lots of caramel and molasses sweetness stays on your lips when time goes on. 


Mouthfeel: Full medium heavy, melting carbonation, very creamy and smooth. Light warming of the alcohol at the end, but goes with the overall concept and it should be there.


Overall: Probably one of the best examples of this style, the alcohol notes are present but get a bit annoying only in the taste (that last spike of bitterness). Smell is rich and smooth, could smell it all day, the taste is smooth enough and makes me appreciate the scotch ale style a bit more (not my favourite). The appearance and mouthfeel are superb. A bit of ageing could probably make it even smoother.

(750) Nice dark brown tint with bubbles racing up all around the sides. Pours with a reddish hue drinking out of a Dogfish Head Signature Glass so I cant see thru the brew. Nice little brown head. Sweet smell and the taste is also sweet that had some bitterness afterwards but that went away as it warmed up a bit, Thick and seems to stick to my mouth which in this case is a good thing. Doesnt seem like a 10%er but Im sure that will change once I finished the bottle. I like this beer and would drink it again.

A robust and creamy experience that doesn't shy away from its complexity. Instead it charges through and comes up with a unique and satisfying malty beverage. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle. A really well done beer. Chalky brown-black, with a slight red tint. Patchy beige head. Rich caramel aroma, depth comes out the more it warms. Chocolate liqueur notes. I love that they make a beer this big and flavorful without oddball adjuncts or barrel aging. Deep rich malt tones with a steady alcohol warmth. Well exceedingmy expectations, this is a truly phenomenal beer.
I could get pretentious with my review of this beer, like so many others. This simply is a great tasting beer.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2014 750 ml bottle shared with Calm_Dreamer and Imperallis. Dark ruby, hazy color with a nice, brown thick head. Aromas of caramel, honey, alcohol, wine, dark fruits, resins.. and so many more!! Excellent taste, very sweet of caramel, resins, alcohol, some wood (???) cognak and Bailley?s notes!! Long aftertaste, very sweet!! Full body with low carbonation!!!!

Too deep and dark amber ruby brown body with brown full foamy head. Aroma of acohol, wine, caramel, raisins. Same taste with a hint of cognac. Very full syrupy body. Well balanced, it goes down easily. Very long lasting aftertaste that leaves a sweet burning feeling in the chest.

Initially pitch black that turns to a dark crimson when held up to a light. Head is about a finger think and khaki colored; leaves behind good lacing. Aroma of caramel, vanilla, scotch, oak, smoked malts and rum raisin. Flavors of caramel, scotch, vanilla, chocolate, rum raisin, dark fruits, smoked malts and a dry hopped aftertaste. Body is on the heavier side but has a smooth and creamy texture. Soooo good!

Bottle at BrewDog Shepherd Bush on 1 February 2014. Poured a very dark chestnut with a thin, off-white head and some lacing. Nutty aroma with strong caramel and earthy notes. Initial flavours not unlike port with some molasses and biscuity malt. Full bodied and smooth mouth feel. Finish was liquorice, dark rum and chewy malt. Lovely stuff.
Bottle from the internets. Pours a deep amber with ample light tan head. Aroma of caramel and booze. Taste of the darkest fruits and booze. Caramel is slightly stated. Great beer for rating #400.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 On tap poured into a 4 oz shaker sampler glass. I probably didnt give this one a fair shot though; as I was sampling this, the brewmaster came out with a sample of the barrel aged wee heavy which he said they were beginning to bottle up. Im sure this is a mighty fine scotch ale as everything else these guys put forward is incredible, but the barrel aged version is that much more special - it was hard to believe they came from the same initial batch. The aroma is that of dark fruits - primarily figs and raisin - with some light chocolate notes. Its a dark, nearly opaque, caramel color with a thin eggshell colored head that leaves no lace. Its a malty, medium-high sweet malty taste. Its a medium bodied beer with a thick, sticky texture and a fizzy carbonation. It finishes smoky and chocolatey.

The aroma is earth, chocolate, smoke, peat. The appearance is deep ruby, translucent, off white head. The flavor is chocolate, caramel, smoked peat. The finish is smoke, pine. Medium/thick in body. Pretty nice.
This is worth all the hype. The aroma is dominated by traditional caramel. For all us scotch ale fanatics, this is a must.

Pours a dark red brown. Aroma is dark fruits, earthy, peat, a little smoke. Taste is similar, sweet dark malt caramel, with the sufficient hops growing in the middle and leaving a balanced lingering aftertaste. Not bad and not much sign of alcohol.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 9.4 ounces, bottled on 07/10/13, purchased at Belmont Station on January 16 2014, savoured on February 2 2014; eye: dark brown with burgundy reflections, semi-opaque, nice sheet of beige head, average lacing; nose: alcohol, caramel, peat, light smoke, malt, molasses; mouth: alcohol, caramel, light smoke, peat, malt, molasses, plum, chocolate, finale in peat with presence of alcohol, medium-full body, good carbonation, mildly sweet, slightly bitter, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 9,4 onces, 10,0 %, embouteillée le 07/10/13, achetée chez Belmont Station le 16 janvier 2014, savourée le 2 février 2014; il : brun foncé avec des reflets bourgogne, semi-opaque, belle couverture de mousse beige, dentelle moyenne; nez : alcool, caramel, tourbe, léger fumé, malt, mélasse; bouche : alcool, caramel, léger fumé, tourbe, malt, mélasse, prune, chocolat, finale en tourbe avec présence dalcool, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, moyennement sucré, très légèrement amère, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : bien

Bottle 750 ml at home, into a tulip glass. ABV 10%
Dark brown colour on the body with red shades. One finger of beige head, good density and very good retention in spite of its low size. Thin film of foam left behind, along with light lacing.
Very nice aroma of dark fruits, prunes, figs, black raisins.
Taste is nicely sweet, again with plenty of dark fruits. Lots of prunes, some vanilla, molasses. The alcohol very well hidden, in no case tastes like a 10%.
Medium body, low carbonation that works very good here, a little sticky on the palate. 
Great beer, only I should be careful, this is dangerously drinkable.

2007 bottle, God bless Walt. Aroma brings caramel and sweet woody malts. Flavor has lost the peat and booze notes nicely bringing a smooth lightly sweetened malty beer with some caramel way on the back end so pleasant on the tongue.

Bardzo złożone piwo. W aromacie dominują nuty przywołujące na myśl doppelbocka, czyli potężna słodowość, karmel, na szczęście kontrastowane to jest aromatem kremowym, czekolada mleczna, lekkie suszone owoce. W smaku dzieje się jeszcze więcej i jeszcze lepiej: jako pierwsza uderza kremowa tekstura, co dość zaskakujące, przyjemna czekolada przechodzi w silniejszy karmel pełny suszonych owoców. Pełne i zaklejające, atakujące alkoholową goryczką przywodzącą na myśl szlachetne likiery, niezwykle rozgrzewające. Całkiem wysoka pijalność jak na tak tęgie piwo. No i doskonałe ułożenie! Spodziewałem się wyższej gorzyczki chmielowej i ciekawszego, mniej doppelbockowego aromatu, ale i tak jest to znakomite piwo.

Into a thistle, the appearance has a dark brown close to brown colored body with a two finger white foamy head that dies at a nice pace; lacing is extremely light and tries to cling but spider webs and slides; the aroma has a nice assortment of caramels, chocolates, the normal light peat that usually comes in a Scotch ale, slightly boozy; the taste is sweet through the previously mentioned flavors; nice boozy somewhat chocolatey aftertaste; the finish is really interesting actually, I get the sense that it wants to be dry, hmmm....but comes across slightly smooth and sweet, maybe even somewhat sticky; on the palate, this one sits about a medium in body; sessionable - not really, more of a sipper; carbonation comes across slightly smooth; overall wow, I really like this Scotch Ale, wow, the ABV seems to have died a bit in the taste and mouthfeel since its from April of 2013, but hey, I must have had it at the exact right time as theres just enough "boozy" feel for a nice Alaskan winters night

Bottle kindly shared by Cuso, thank you! Aroma strong chocolate, fruits, plums. High ABV sensor is beeping. Dark brown colour. Taste is alcoholey, boozy, some sourness present. Under that, roasted malts, chocolate, plums. Not exactly great, overdone with aggressive alcohol. Burning boozy finish. Not to my taste unfortunately.
Bottle into a tulip. Caramel colored with a thin but complex palate - decent, but probably wont buy again.
