750ml bottle. Clear mahogany with a off-white head. Aroma is dark fruits, molasses, roasted malts and smoke. Taste is malty sweetness, toffee, cherry, raisins, nuts and peat. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, chewy and creamy texture. Well hidden alcohol, surprising drinkability.

@ Jungle Jims / Eastgate OH - Clear dark ruby mahogany with a thin head cover and lace that slowly drops back into the drink. Taste is sparkling toasted malt. It grows through the palate adding fruit cake and earth. The finish is mildly bittered, a bit watery, but last a surprisingly long time, growing sweeter as it lingers. A big brew that needs to be enjoyed slowly. Good stuff.

bottle @ALEhouse, Riga
Pours brown with coppery-reddish tones, no top, just a thin foam layer, thick and deep bubbly it looks. Aroma - sweet, deep caramel-malty, dark caramel with toasted, darker malts presence, pleasant. Taste - sweet with good pleasant bitter from hopping and dark malt, but not roasted, more mild. Thick mouthfeel, light astringent and pungent on tongue, light dry finish with long, roast-bitter mild aftertaste. Flavor seems a bit unbalanced for such style, too pungent, too malt sharp but with a pleasant hopping level. Carbonation level also seems a bit too high to fully enjoy scotch ale.

Pours a deep Brown color with amber reflects and a big tan head. Aromas are coffee, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel and raisins. Sweetness, bitterness and booze in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber poured into snifter. Creamy head with a dark chestnut body. Smells of toffee, caramel, slight dark fruit, and roasty malts. Tastes of caramel, molasses and roasted nuts. Begins sweet upfront with a hint of honey, settles smoothly with a malty roast, then finishes with a smokey tone. Very solid beer.

Bottle. Pours brown with red hues, tan head. Smells sweet, banana, slight clove, raisins and a touch of wood. Has a really nice smooth, easy drinking flavor. Good amount of fruit- banana- lots of raisin, nice wood backtone, sweet spices. Its really nice and very easy to drink. An amazing beer for the style!!

Dark rich brown and azure colour. Aroma has lots going on - oaken malt smell, subtle peat. Taste is very well balanced with an extremely hidden abv; flavours pitched between savoury and sweet, smoke and malt. Dry finish. Malts come out to play as it warms. Overall, a very good beer.

Bottle from brewdog e-shop. Dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of plums red berries, chocolate, alcohol. Fruity taste with chocolate, candies, red berries, plums, sweet molasses, nuts, licorice. Tasty.
Bottle by Cuso, many thanks! Not so my beer style. Alcohol present and a bit aggressive, not warming. Very malty, a good beer liquor! But like I said, not so my style.

Poured from bottle. Dark brown color. Sour cherry, chocolate, burned sugar in flavor. Full body, lively carbonated. Cloying sweet in beginning, some bitterness in aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, courtesy of Cuso, many thanks. Pours dark brown color, barge head. Aroma is milk chocolate, candy sugar, alcohol, plums. Taste is sweet, chocolate, coffee, sugar, alcohol, cherries, caramel.

750ml bottle shared. Pours a very dark amber. Sweet nose. Caramel, chocolate, plums, vanilla, and just more sugar. Very sweet and rich. A rush of sugar and then some subtle dark fruit, almost like prunes and raisins. A bit of smokiness as it warms. A very big beer that tastes like a big beer.

Pours deep brown ruby, three finger light tan head.

Smell big malty sweetness, bit of gum, smokey.

Taste sweet smokey, earth, coco, roast, bit of heat on tail

Medium body

Nice

Rating #600. Pours almost black with dark brown tones and a fairly compact foam tan head. Aroma is caramel, honey, figs, dates, roasted walnuts, molasses. Taste is caramel, figs, dates, molasses, plum, slight taste of smoked bacon, honey, hints of chocolate. Mouthfeel is quite creamy with almost no carbonation. Aftertaste sees the chocolate much more to the fore, with caramel, maple syrup, roasted walnuts and chestnuts. Extremely well balanced and just great!
Dark with medium head. Aroma of chocolate, hazlenuts, caramel. Taste complex, rounded caramel, roasted malts, some coffee.
Dark brown with a reddish shine. Good sized and decent holding head. Dark fruits, roasted malts, slightly smoked, some chocolate. Nice mixture. Good balance of sweetness and bitterness.

Bottle at Theis. Clear dark chestnut brown with a medium sized diminishing off white head. Nutty, caramel, oxidized, toasted malt, light wort, grain, light roasted malt. Soft and mellow. Medium/full body, oily texture, soft carbonation.

Bottle at Theis LA-box tasting. Pours a clear dark brown with a tiny off-white head. Sweet and bitter with aromas of light chocolate, pale malts and some German hops. Also coco nut and knækbrød. Medium to full bodied. Soft carbonation. Sweet finish.
On tap pours amber with low head ad lacing, aroma is light sweet malt, taste is bitter sweet malt with a nice smooth finish

Poured from a 750mL bottle into Spiegelau tulip glass. 

A: Copious amounts of sweet malts with caramel and dark fruit notes. Surprisingly more subtle and smooth that I anticipated for the style. 
A: Pours a deep garnet in color, almost opaque. with a thin cap of light-brown head and a few small spots of lacing down the glass.
T: As expected, an extremely malty profile with toffee and roasted malts taking the forefront, melting into candied sugar and dark fruit flavors. Finished with a warming alcohol, quite strong. 
P: For a 10% ABV, it is actually pretty thin and light bodied with low carbonation, which makes this easy to drink. 
O: An OUTSTANDING example of the style, I am very impressed with this beer and brewery. Its much more complex than many of the other wee heavy out there and it hides the alcohol so well that its actually a sniper.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip. Pours black, but when held up to a light it is a slightly translucent dark crimson with small beige head. Caramel aroma, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is complex caramel, chocolate, hint of alcohol, and molasses. Expected to really like this one, but a bit too heavy for me.
10/20/2012. 750 ml. bottle. Pours redbrown with an off-white head. Aromas of caramel, spice, dark roasted malt, chocolate. Bitter from the hops with booze right off. Good stuff!

Nice aroma that fades. Not to sweet but almost lacks in body over time. But overall well balanced. Nice brew. Maybe not the best but up there. No head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle
Dark brown , almost no head 
Smell is earthy , sweet , bit grains 
Taste is sweet , yet bitter . Ok . Yet not to special

When you open the bottle, the aroma is subtle. The ale doesnt show you much, she wants you to drink it. Then, she shows its qualities. Exceptional and, in fact, a big ale. When I drink it, I remind the magnificent Ayinger Celebrator but much, much better. Full malt flavour, with its sweetness but very balanced (chocolate malts?). Smooth hop flavour. Alcohol? Its playing a hide-and-seek game with your mouth with superb ability.

The pee of gods, as a friend of mine said. Or a malted masterpiece. Brutal job, Alesmith.

slight brown head that disappears with lacing. cola coloured. aroma is malt, caramel, vanilla, cloying, boozy. taste like aroma with sweet finish and roasted malts. quite dense body, soft carbonation. thanks for sharing belgBG

I think Tim and Rachel brought this one in. Deep amber brown pour with a bubbly white head. Sweet malty aroma, nutty, dark fruits and molasses. Thick rich flavor with all the above mentioned flavors and a nice balance thats not cloying. Pretty tasty.
Pours a hazy copper brown from the bottle with minimal bubbly head and lacing. Aroma of slight smoke and heavy caramel malt. Taste follows, nice balance and alcohol well hidden. Great beer.
very malty, sugar, dark fruit, roasty. Fairly complex. Smooth, silky, full body.

Pours a deep dark brown. Large creamy light brown head, moderately lasting with good lace. Great complex malty sweet, roasty; toffee, caramel, dark fruit, some chocolate, light smoke and spices. Mouthfeel as described: lush, full, rounded. Great balance - clean. Sweet/roast/bitter/alcoholwarmth. Complex. Super enjoyable. So well made.

Bottiglia 75cl, ordinata su domus birrae e bevuta a casa.
rubino carichissimo, quasi nera,
con schiuma marroncina finissima e persistente.
Al naso sentori da dopplebock, molto malto e frutta matura.
In bocca conferma una maltatura predominante, alcol sul finale che si fa amaro.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

750 ml from Total Wine Sac, bottle from December 2011, sugar aroma, flavor is raw sugar and malt. Great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color caoba oscuro con espuma color crema generosa y densa. Aromas de caramelo, azúcar y maltas tostadas. En boca, con dendidad media-alta, es predominantemente dulce con matices de azúcar tostado y frutas confitadas. El final es ligeramente amargo y afrutado, como el regusto. Muy rica.
Bottle shared. Brown with a tan head. Caramel, toffee, malt, dark fruit, light smoke, light alcohol, fairly sweet. Medium to full body. Very nice scotch ale.

Schokoalde und melasse im geschmack, feinherb, süss dominierend, leichte alkoholnote, warmer/harmonischer abgang

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a big creamy light tan head that retains well and laces the glass some.

The aroma is sweet smokey peat malts.

The flavor is sweet caramel and toffee malts with a little dark fruit and some smokey peat in the finish. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with light carbonation.

Overall, nice scotch ale - a little too sweet.
Huge biscuit and dark fruit nose. Alcohol was not overbearing. Lots of dark fruit and brown sugar notes. Didnt get the smokiness at all. Suprising smoothness. Awesome
mahogany colour, medium beige head;aroma ofscotch whiskey, plum, biscuit, and hints of alcohol; taste of scotch again, oak barrel, caramel, and a bit too intensive alcohol;not bad, but not my style

Bottle. Pours dark reddish brown with a tan thin head. Aroma on this beer is caramel, sweet malt, oak char, light smoke and raisins. Taste is sweet malts, caramel, charred oaky smoke barrel. Very balanced, medium body smooth beer. Another top notch Alesmith beer!

Darkest of brown with garnet hues and yellow tan head. Smoky dark fruit - plums, raisin, dark cherry with light roasted malt. Flavor is more of the deep, complex dark plum and cherry that fades to roasted malt and brown sugar. Big and a bit boozy. Nonetheless, a top-notch scotch ale.

Bottle. Pours brown with tan head, settles quickly. Minimal lacing. Aroma is sweet, fruity, plum, grape, alcohol. Flavor is very sweet, alcohol and plum up front with a mildly roasted, charred malt, chocolate, and dark fruit finish. Roasted, chocolate aftertaste. A very sweet beer, alcohol comes across almost fruity. Nicely roasted and balanced, alcohol is well hidden. Gets even richer as it warms. Medium body, soft carbonation and smooth texture. A very good beer.

Pours a clear, dark mahogany/ruby color with a fluffy light khaki head. Nose is sweet and boozy, some dark fruits, caramel, and very malty. Notes of dark fruit on the taste, molasses, cocoa, caramel, fairly sweet, and a nice light smokiness in the finish. Very smooth, not overly sweet, and just very big.
Pours near black with off white head and great lacing. Aroma of sweet caramel with some dark malts. Taste is nutty and scotch malts with some licorice. Great beer.

Aroma: soft bitter chocolate with mellow alcohol notes. Appearance: murky brown with beige and foamy head. Taste: Chocolate gives way to molasses and finishes with a boozy/scotch cherry note. Palate: lively carbonation, thin mouth feel. 

I am not a scotch ale person, but Wee Heavy has changed my mind. Its a rare thing to find a beer that carries the weight of its style but still manages to assert a character that cant be found anywhere else. Alesmith does just that routinely, and Wee Heavy is no exception. Smooth chocolate, molasses, with a dry cherry-scotch finish--this beer is a must have.

An amazing wee heavy. Doesn't initially come across as a wee heavy. Big chocolate notes, a nice cherry sweetness, no smokiness like the description says. The heavy, overbearing booziness of most scotch ales is not present. The alcohol heat is barely there, perfectly masked and intertwined with the chocolate. Almost reminiscent of KBS or other dark, chocolately brews. Incredibly unique. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Dark brown/ruby with an ivory finger thick head which quickly disappears to a glass ring foam.
Aroma: Nutty, vinous, dried fig, fruit cake, marzipan, vanilla, toffee and notes of whisky and peat. 
Taste: Medium sweetness, low bitterness and medium sourness. The taste is dried fruit, a slight earthy/peat note, toffee and whisky notes.
Palate: Thick texture and mouthfeel with a medium/heavy body, it is astringent and has low carbonation. The finish lingers with a sweet and sourness, with dried fruit in the mix and a whisky like kick at the end. 
Comments: Delicious. This is probably one of the best beers I have had. No glass lacing.

Pours a deep amber colour, almost black in appearance with a huge frothy tan head. Aroma is strong and smokey, with pronounced caramel notes and slight hop scents; very malty aroma. Taste is not as sweet as I may have expected, the bitterness is slight and dry though so it does not overtake the sweetness. Full body, softer carbonation, and creamy on the palate. Awesome scotch ale overall.
Tasting at Kevins. 2011 bottle. Malty aroma. Sweet. Low carbonation. Raisin. Dried fruit. Almost barley wine.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2013 Bottle. Pours about the darkest brown possible. Light tan head. Aroma is moderate to heavy caramel light to moderate roasted nuts and smoke. Taste is light sweetness, lightly bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is sticky, carbonation is average, long finish.

Sweet caramel aroma. Dark brown with a creamy light brown head. Tastes like coffee liquor. Light and refreshing. Like a stout without the heaviness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a very dark amber with a light taupe head, perpetually fed by carbonation bubbles from the bottom. Chocolate fudge nose, some cinnamon, with a lot of alcohol invading the olfactory. Aroma is reminiscent of FW Double DBA. Viscous mouthfeel that ads to the richness of the beer. Theres certainly an Oktoberfest on steroids with this one. Spicy, chocolaty, fudgy, creamy, smooth. Not much to dislike.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2013 750 mL bottle. Cola brown with a small brown head that never quite disappears. Appealing and complex aroma has nuts, toffee, caramel, smoke and cola. The flavour is incredibly complex for the style, with chocolate and a touch of alcohol added to the elements of the nose. Some mocha even makes an appearnce as it warms.  Medium-low carbonation, so nothing gets in the way of the flavours. Big, beautiful beer.

Bottle. Big thanks to Owen. Guessing its around a year or so old. Perfect dark brown pour with a small khaki head. Very good retention and its veyr thick and sticky. Nothing to say here which hasnt already been said. Its very buttescotch forward with heavy powdery chocolate. Great balance and drinkability. Booze hidden. Mouth feel is creamy and lengthy. Great scotch ale and I can see why it is so highly touted

75cl bottle in Brewdog Edinburgh shared with friends. Pours black with small brown frothy head. Nose is dark roasted malts, raisin, plum, brown sugar. Tastes sweet, light bitter, and boozy. Chocolate, raisin, only a little coffee. Med-heavy body. Nice brew, glad we tried it.

75cl bottles shared at home. Tried twice now, thought I had rated previously, but obviously not. Lovely dark brown pour, with good tan head. 1st bottle six months ago was all about the sugars - caramel, toffee, demerara. Big flavours and body, but too sweet on the finish. Six months later cracking bottle number two, some of the smoke is starting to come out, and the finish is perfect, that excess sweetness has disappeared. If you buy this fresh, I highly recommend ageing it 6 months minimum (unless you like really sweet beer).
Pours a rich, dark brown with ample, frothy head. Lot of caramel malts, fairly yeasty. Full of interesting flavors, rich, the smoke/liquor balance the sweet nicely. Very well put together beer.

Dark espresso pour with khaki brown thick head. Brutally boozy aroma with sweet, roasty, dark fruit notes. Real heavy mouthfeel. Not nearly as boozy flavor. Very sweet. Smooth raisin, plum jelly like flavor. Easy finish. Great taste when compared to the harshness of the aroma. 

---Rated via iPhone

Sweet, thick full body. Carmel/chocolate aromas with a touch of smoke. A lot of strong alcohol flavor comes through but it balances out the sweetness. I dont know if its possible to make this beer any more perfect.
Bottle shared with friends. Im glad I was finally able to try this beer but its pretty much a malty mess. Not really my cup of tea, especially in FL weather.

Bomber from Bottleworks. Cellar aged for 8 months. Shared with ck1 and my other brother. Pours brown with a brown head. Aroma has sweet brown sugar and peat with a bit of alcohol. Taste follows. Tasty. Medium bodied, sticky. ck1 says buttery & 15. Well worth stashing it in my briefcase for the buses, trains and planes.

Clear brownish ruby with medium beige head. Lacing
Aroma.. intense malty, caramel, dried fruits, decent hops, vanilla, bit alcohol
Sweet with decent bitterness, some notes of sourish. Creamy
Great brew, awesomy balanced and enjoyable top-class beer

[US West Coast Trip 2013] Tap @ Alesmith Brewing Co. San Diego. Svart med rostade toner. Lite vanilj och trä. Söt från alkoholen som smygs in väldigt bra. Börjar bli tjatigt att skriva men Alesmith och balans! Oh yeah
Drought. Dark brown with small tan foamy head, coffee aroma with a whiff of scotch, stinging taste of scotch over the coffee flavor with a long finish. Very nice mixture of whisky and coffee

Bottle from Ryan, nice light ruby brown pour with a white head, nice lacing. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel and as it sits it almost gets a cocoa/chocolate. Taste is A bunch of malt, roasted malt, nice caramel, pretty good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

June 14, 2013 - bottle from Everetts.  Dark brown pour with nice amount of head that faded quickly and decent lacing.  Aroma was caramel, roast and alcohol.  Taste was consistent with aroma with some chocolate and a dry finish.

Bomber into tulip glass. Alcohol aroma followed by caramel and chocolate malt. Pours dark brown with a tinge of red with a thin, brown head. Taste is caramel and chocolate malt with a bit of hops to balance it out. Finishes smooth with a bit of smokiness with only a trace of alcohol. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75 cl bottle @ home. Pours reddish brown with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is malt, caramel, nuts, and dried fruit. Flavour is caramel, nuts, dried fruit, and some warming alcohol.

Bottle from brewdog.com, shared june 7th 2013. Thick dark brown body, quite big light brown head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, raisins and hops. Taste of dried red fruits, a touch of roast, caramel and mocca. Quite nice taste, only disturbed with a bit too present alcohol taste. Nice bittersweet feel through all, with a barely noticable smoke element, and a sweet fruity finish, leaving a warm feeling.

750 aged over a year, extra from Dak, thanks man.  Dark crimson pour.  Malty, lots of dark fruit in this raisins and figs.  No hops, minimal sweetness.  Very thick.  This is a better version of robert the bruce.
This has been one of my favorites for a long time. Very drinkable and smooth mouthful.

A dark brown ale with a thin mocha head. In aroma, a sweet burned malt with vanilla notes, wooden notes,  burned caramel, licorice, very nice. In mouth, a smooth sweet caramel with licorice, loads of burning alcohol, very nice.
Delicious sweet aroma of molasses/chocolate. Very dark brown pour, very easy to drink. Fantastic beer.

bottle to glass(es); had with Darren from Scottland.  not a huge armoa - but I got malt and caramel.  mahagony hazy brown pour.  taste was sweet - to the edge of over sweet but never crossed it - malt and caramel and more caramel.  nice med thick palate and nice dring finish.  not better than the best scotch ales I have tried, but on par with them.

Dark Mahogany with ruby highlights. One finger light mocha colored head with excellent retention. Does fall to a nice collar. Good waves of lacing. 

Nose is molasses, caramel, chocolate, nuts, and dark stewed fruits. Inviting smell. 

Superb taste. Caramel, molasses, milk chocolate with nuts and stewed fruits.

Deep,  long lasting finish. Well hidden ABV. Lots of molasses and caramel in the mouth. 
 
Superb beer
On tap in San Diego. Dark chocolate malt, moderate alcohol, slightly nutty, some licorice.

Firm cola brown body, shade of haze but beige fizzy head. Earthy fresh wet compost nose with spriteful brown sugar tinge. Oaky but smooth carbonation combo slips a silly ABV away easily. Meaty malt in the middle without hanging around too long, complex without being overpowering. Sweetness is constant but allows a little room for a crystal tang linger. Teeth gummingly gud liiiike.  Bottle, Sighthill Tasting
This puppy is a choker.  Wow. Pile of scotch n guiness combined. Good and sweet. Thick n black.  Good shi

Poured from a bottle into a tulip glass. Dark brown/hazel pour with a two toned dark brown to light brown head. Smell is dominated by caramel and sweets, malts, and almost belgian yeast notes. Medium carbonation, malty caramel body, pretty full body with a smooth yeasty finish that is slightly bitter and dry.

Bottle. Tootsie roll brown color, excellent light foam that dissipates slightly but leaves a nice layer of bubbles resting on top. Smooth milk chocolate and fudge aroma, some hazelnut. Taste focuses on the hazelnut, some molasses/chocolate-like note, and alcohol. A hint of char too. Excellent brew.
Poured an amber brown color feom the bottle with aromas of malt, light nuts, booze, and some grain.. Flavors arw the same almost a bready nutty concaution woth some light booze in the aftertaste.

I usually avoid scotch ales...dont know why really...just do.  Intentionally wanted to try something new tonight, so I picked up this bottle that has been available for years in Cincinnati, OH.  What can I say?  Im really enjoying this  heavy hitter.  I could just copy and paste the description from above because it is more apt than any of my observations could reveal.  This is a powerful caramel bomb! - 750 ml bottle into the highest grade snifter money can buy.

Opaque brown with a medium, dense, creamy creme head. Aroma is raisins and some dried fruits, peaty and smokey finish. Flavor is raisins with some burnt sugar and molasses, some slight fruit cake as well with a sweet and warming aftertaste. Medium to full palate, packed with flavor, warming but not alocholic, alcohol very well hidden.

Pours dark with a foamy cream head. Aroma is butter cream, toasted malt, and caramel. Taste is butter, malt, spices, and rich toffee. Smooth and creamy on the palate. Im blown away by the mastery of this brew.

On tap at AleSmith. Deep mahogany pour. Subtle molasses on the nose with heavy malts and hints of chocolate and spice. Caramel & toffee up front balanced by pleasant hop bitterness on the finish. Hints of fruit (raisons and prunes?) linger on the finish.

Dark brown, big nicotine head. Big malty sweet slightly boozie aroma with some toffee, fruit and hints of peated malt. The taste is big, sweet and warm. Big mouthfeel, low carbonation. A very, you guessed it, big beer.

Pours nice dark ruby brown with beige fizz. Nice lightly Smokey aroma with roasted grains. The flavors are nice smooth roasted malt with a alcohol driven sweetness and light amount of smoke. Hits the dark roasted flavors for not being to dark with some earthy dryness. Top notch.

Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörk, nästan svart vätska, med klar inblandning av rött. Skummet lägger sig snabbt. Intensiv doft av choklad, syltiga röda bär och honung. Denna dryck handlar allt om malt. Humlebeskan finns bara där och balanserar smaken så den inte blir sötsliskig. Smak av toffekola och farinsocker. Ölets kropp fyller hela munhålan utan att alkoholen påminner sig om sin närvaro. Lång angenäm eftersmak.

Aroma is dark malts, light sweetness and very nutty.  The flavor is dark and very nutty malts, small vinous notes, an undercurrent of sweetness and a mix of warming alcohol and tartness in the finish.

750 ml bottle from Leeds Brewdog. Pours a cola like black colour with a creamy head. In the nose caramel malty goodness, dates and red berries with almonds and a bit of marzipan.  Sweet but not sickly. Warming without any unpleasant alcohol flavour. Nicely balanced & smooth ale that hides the 10% abv. very well. Another really good beer from Alesmith. Excellent.

On tap as the Trestle Inn.
Appearance: Dark clear garnet, thin tan creamy head.
Aroma: Light smoke and malts.
Taste: Smokey, malty, and dark fruits.
Palate: Thick, oily, medium carbonation.
Overall: Solid beer, but Im not a big fan.

Bottle split with IGT at BD Camden, 19/03/13.
Hazed chestnut brown with a thin beige head that clears to the edge and leaves a swirl atop the glass.
Nose carries toffee, dates, dark fruits, brown sugar, touch of booze.
Taste comprises dark fruit, rich dark toffee, dates, figs, nutty tones, booze but well balanced.
Full end of medium bodied with soft carbonation leading to a touch of booze in the finish.
Decent enough fayre and pretty driknkable, Ive mentioned booze 3 times but it is well integrated for a 10% job!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Medium brown head.  Black body goes clear deep dark red at edges.
Deep caramelly fruity vanilla fudge aroma with chocolatey red
berry notes.  Dry-sweet earthy butterscotch and soy sauce taste
with dusty red berry notes.  Full-bodied.  Dry roasty soy sauce
and earth aftertaste with cardamom, vanilla fudge, and dried
fruit notes.  Aftertaste could use a little more bit, otherwise
very nice and and drinkable.  (0.75l bottle, from somewhere in
Copenhagen, I think.)

Pours a dark brown, almost coffee, color with fast-receding tan head. Malty, sweet, alcohol forward aroma, with some toffee notes. Taste is sweet with toffee and alcohol most prominent. Smooth finish and silky mouth feel. Good beer.

75 cl bottle from Brewdog.com. Pours deep amber with a 2 finger tan head that leaves a good lacing. Malty aroma with caramel, smoke, toffee and some alcohol notes. Flavor is complex and rich, and reminds me of some good and heavy barley wines... Heavy body, light carbonation, dry finish with a good alcohol feel. Nice one .

Frothy tan head soft carbonation cola like pour aromas rich maltiness toffee caramel fruity hops nut rich fruity hops the flavours syrup sweet toffee caramel dark fruit nuttiness rich brown sugar smooth on palate the finish malty sweet aftertaste rich toffee syrup hoppy fruit nice on palate
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  1.7.2010

Pours a thin looking clear, dark brown. Frothy head. Also, this beer gives head like your stepmom. Uneven and jagged, with a snarl tooth. Candi sugar, sweet malt I they nose, along with a slight twinge of Pete. No, not Pete the guy who showed you his ding dong in 5th grade, pete as in smoked peat.  Not a whole lotta roast going on, but upon the first sip it is revealed that this beer is very sugary. Super sweet, under attenuated, syrupy. Bleh. Based on the ratings, I was hoping for something mind blowing from this beer but instead I got a mouthful of garbage juice. Like, literally carbonated sugar water with a dash of rum thrown in. Fucken garbage.
Big bottle, rated from backlog. Notes of chocolate, rye, alcohol and some metallic notes Taste is sweet with cane sugar and malts.

Bottle at a bottle share. Pours a dark brown color with a moderate head. Nose is extremely malty, with a variety of malt notes. Taste is actually a tad sweet with some roasting in there. Pretty good brew...

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2013 Wow this bad boy was so very very d e l i c i o u s! Nice breadyness. Off-white, medium sized creamy head. Excellent lacing. Fully lasting. Malty, yeasty, lightly sweet and lightly bitter up front. Alcohol and hops blast the senses while almost covering notes of prunes and dark fruits  rich sweet flavor. One of the best beers I have ever had.

My first beer from Ale Smith did not disappoint!  The aroma is quite boozy and malty.  The pour is black with a nice tan head that leaves a perfect ring around the top of glass.  The taste is definitely dominated by the caramel malt and finishes with a touch of bitterness.  The palate is perfect!  At 10%, the mouthfeel is so creamy and almost light despite the robust flavor of this beer.  Very, very well done!

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from LeopoldStoch.  Thanks Brandon! It pours a hazy ruddy, copper color with a dense tan head.  The nose has nice caramel, bread, and malt notes with just a hint of chocolate.  The flavor follows suit with a nice malty sweetness and a bit of dried fruit and spice cake.  I didnt get anything in the way of peat or smoke, and thats okay.  Full bodied with a medium finish, the 10% abv is deceptively subtle.  This one will sneak up on you.  Definitely tasty and highly recommended.

Aroma of sweet intoxicating malt.  Notes of rye, chocolate, iron and booze.   Pours black red with nice film.  Taste is sweet with cane sugar and malts.  Very indescript other than sweet.  Sure to mess you up.

750 mL bottle from Total Wine in Tucson, served in a stem glass. Pours clear mahogany with a moderate, frothy tan head that fades slowly to a thin cover and leaves a small amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are big notes of caramel, brown sugar, molasses and biscuit malts, along with chocolate, vanilla and a hint of delicate hops. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout, with plenty of chocolate and molasses. Towards the end, slight notes of pepper and smoke emerge to provide a nice accent. The finish is long and malty, with chocolate, vanilla and molasses. On the palate, it is medium-full in body with a smooth, milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a great Scotch ale. It is a bigg, heavy example, but the 10% ABV is well hidden behind enormous malts. A great wintertime sipper. 2012-12-28

Draft at Khyber Pass. Very dark clear red brown pour with a slim tan head. Very malty. Medium dark red fruits. Some darker ashy notes. Enough spice and hops to give it a dryer finish. Full malt flavors but palate is a bit watery. Bit disappointed.
Bottle pours a dark red/brown with an off white head. Scent is very malty, with fruits and yeast. Taste is dark fruits, sweet and roasty. Very Good!

Slightly hazy chestnut pour with a 2 finger, soapy, tan head that has great retention and leaves respectable lacing. Thick layers of malt in the aroma, lots of caramel and nutty notes, wood, a touch of smoke, some toffee, dried tree and dark fruit, a hint of chocolate, herbal and light pine hops, and dates. The flavor is similarly complex and rich, lots of caramel and toffee right away, dark fruit, brandy, sweet bread spice dried fruit, chocolate, sweet earthy tubors, light roast, smoke, nice woody notes, roasted nuts, light pine and herbal hops, dark toast, licorice and sweet tobacco. Heavy body, light carbonation, creamy, slightly syrupy feel until the slightly more dry finish with a good wallop of (pleasant) boozy warmth. Fantastic beer, I was in the mood for a winter warmer, and this fits that very well.
Tasty no doubt. This is full of taste, but maybe not to my taste. Big, bradhy, malty.

Bottle from Dom and Bish. Dom has described this experience to a tee (see below). Provided an excellent backdrop to cheese. Very brown. The malt was unrelenting, making it a smidge singular and sickly. Perhaps it suffered against the other beers this evening.

I was looking forward to this for weeks. It was good but in truth the malt was overpowering and was too dominant. Malt, malt, malt and a bit more malt. Went well with salami Milano and Stilton though.
Dark and roasty, tobacco, leather. Sweet malt in the middle, flanked by booze and burnt malts. A good beer; the BA version is a good deal better.

75 cl. bottle.  Pours a dark brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma of caramel, fruit, brown sugar, and chocolate.  Taste is caramel malt, dark fruit and berries, chocolate, molasses, and smoke.  On the sweet side, but well balanced.  Excellent!
Yes - this is the scotch ale to measure all other scotch ales. On draft at OBC in Ojai, CA. Dark dark amber pour with a nice wispy white head. Malty and smooth, not overbearingly sweet - just nice.
Like all alesmith big beers. Huge malt, big and bold presence, not too huge for its own good.

26 jan 2012, bottle. Dark ruby. Nose is copper malt and slightly acidic. Full body, a bit syrupy, a bit fizzy. Dark chocolate malt, moderate alcohol, slightly nutty, some licorice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750ml bottle split between Duvel tulip & Traquair glass jug.  On the nose there is  p

31.12.12. Bottle. Large off-white foam, fast settle. Reddish beer. Aroma is malty, a bit sweet (dark sugar), hops noticeable. Tastes a bit sweet, alcohol. Mouthfeel smooth. Aftertaste a wee bit watery and clear alcohol. I had high expectations, but the penetrating flavor of alcohol ruined this for me.

Pours dark cola with quickly dissipating head. Aroma is caramel and dark fruits. Taste reveals some molasses and smoke notes. Alcohol punch is a little overwhelming and takes a way from the complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

@ Basunen: doft av bröd malt och russin. Smaken är trevlig salt len och trevlig. Fin lång eftersmak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A very enjoyable winter/cold weather beer. So incredibly smooth and easy to drink. Heavy on the palate but not overly so. Subtle warming character and a nice bready malt base make this one excellent scotch ale.

Dark brown with nice head and lacing.  Chocolate and molasses aroma.  Same on taste with nice sweet finish with some bitterness that fits perfectly and alcohol that works well too.  Full mouthfeel and a bit sticky. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Easily amongst the best of the Scotch Ales that Ive ever had. Has a nice malty sweetness that isnt too sticky. The look of the beer is awesome from the bottle to the color to the foam. Nice. Very nice. Creamy palate. Full but not too heavy. This is basically the perfect scotch ale. Fantastic.

Pours a dark mahogany with big khaki head.  Aroma is molasses and some chocolate. Taste is burnt molasses with some chocolate and a balanced alcohol taste. Vet well balanced taste.  Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75 cl bottle @ OHaras Freehouse. Rated on 01.07.2010
Aroma is sweet with lots of caramel, some toffee, ripe fruits and sugar. Flavour is also rather sweet with caramel, fruits, raisins, toffee and distant woody notes. Sticky palate. Way too sweet for me  but what else could a 10% American Scotch Ale be?

Bottle. Lovely deep mahogany pour with a thick long-lasting light brown head. Aroma is sweet, with cocoa, caramel, light oak, and light smoke. Chewy malty palate, lots of chocolate nicely balanced with some barrel sweetness and booziness, but with a prevalent vinous port-like fruitiness that is just so tasty. Moderate smokiness, but not really peaty. So flavourful and interesting; fantastic.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
My first introduction to the style. It prefers resting a bit after pouring. Reminds me of a tastier barley wine. Pours dark brown with a quickly disappearing head. Somewhat syrupy consistency, but a very nice flavor: not too sweet, and the resting seems to take the edge off the ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Even, oily brown/black with rolling brown espresso crema head.  Aroma is coppery caramelization.  Taste is the richest, most well-rounded example of this style that Ive ever had, and it reminds me a lot of an I-stout with all the edges and peaks leveled out.  Mouthfeel is exceptionally smooth.  Thanks, R. Bassler for the NYE bottle

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Pours brown to black with a beige head, aroma of honey, caramel, nuts, raisins and plums, flavor is sweet with honey, caramel, nuts, plums, chocolate and wood, full bodied, well made

Poured from bottle into tulip. Pours dark brown to black with a big creamy beige head. Aroma is candy sugar, scotch, some peat, raisins, chocolate, and figs. Flavor is chocolate forward and sweet, light carbonation, goes down easy. Only a hint of scotch here and it is going very well with my sharp cheddar. Beautiful scotch whiskey finish. Medium heavy mouthfeel. Wow. This is fantastic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une bouteille obtenue via un échange avec Marheb et partagée avec rodenbach99.  Un liquide brun foncé.  Un mince anneau de mousse.  Des jambes sur la paroi du verre.  Un nez de malts foncés, de mélasse et de caramel brûlé, de fumée et dépices avec des feuilles de tabac, de la réglisse, du fudge et des fruits noirs comme des pruneaux macérés.  Un goût malté complexe et costaud, jamais sucré, avec des céréales foncées très expressives et profondes.  Un savoureux mélange de dattes et de mélasse fruitée, de fumée, de caramel et de réglisse, dépices, de feuilles de tabac séchées au feu et de liqueur spiritueuse.  Une sensation en bouche très agréable.  Un corps solide et bien relevé par des bulles justement actives.  Une texture longue et capiteuse.  Une finale qui perdure avec des notes maltées délicieusement mélangées à une amertume complexifiée par un alcool habilement dangereux.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. A black beer with slight ruby red highlights. It has extremely rich red fruit, liquorice and currant flavours with spicy warmth on the finish.
Ruby brown with a small pale head. Aroma is dates, caramel, malt, brown sugar. Slick mouthfeel, full bodied, sweet on the palate, warm finish. Taste is dates, raisins, toffee, port, fig.

bottle.  yesssss.  found one in cleveland.  muddy dark brown beer with a small, but stable, tan head.  complex caramelly, dark fruit, burnt sugar aromas.  flavors of ripe dark fruits, caramel, toast and hint of cinnamon maybe.  body isnt syrupy thick as you would expect from the appearance.  moderate carbonation.  plummy raisiny.  robust and rich, but very drinkable in quantities.  excellent and every bit good as anticipated!

Dark brown. Small disapating head. Smells caramel sweet, with grassy hint. Bubbley carbonation. Sweet with an alcohol bite at the end. Brown sugar with a bit a smoke. Not too heavy, lighter body. True to the style. Slight linger bitternes to balance the sweet. A very good example of a scotch ale. Highly drinkable for 10% abv. Enjoy!

Pours a dark brown reddish color with a nice small mocha head. Nose is sweet and buttery. It s a sipper. Taste is sweet, certainly no hiding the alcohol, Taste is caramel, buttery, and honey like. Finishes on sweet notes. Nice after dinner drink. quaff score 8  / 10
Pours a dark brown with a tan head and aroma of fruits and malt.  Taste is of fruits, caramel, roasted malt, and chocolate, while sweet with alcohol in the finish. A great sipper beer

Bomber shared with my wife.  Pours a dark brown-red color with a huge head.  Aroma is malt, caramel, chocolate, smoke.  Taste follows - very sweet.  Best thing about it is the incredible thick, creamy mouthfeel.  Very good; looking forward to trying the barrel aged version.

Bottle shared and thanks to chudwick.  Am I drinking a Trappist?  Brown sugar, basement, and dark fruit? Sorry for the questions...just no what i expected from a wee heavy.  Different, Chudwick said it heads the right way towards the end, but.....i am not so sure.

750ml bottle - pours dark brown with beige head. Nose is dark fruit and brown sugar. Flavor is leafy, basement aromas, alcohol and chocolate. Sweet. Not what I expected. Licorice, peat and scotchy aftertaste. Dry. Misleading at first but slowly becoming true to the style.

75cl bottle shared with Neil,Shaun and Lee at BrewDog,Birmingham.
Bottle paid for early and left on table to warm as we sampled some draught ales.Poured a dark ruby brown with medium creamy head.Aromas of caramel malt and chocolate with toffee in the background.On the taste side,all the above with plums raisins and other fruity tastes making a sweetish,smooth and balanced brew which  tatsted even better as it warmed.Excellent.

Pours dark brown with a dark thin head. Aroma is a bit boozy and coffee. Flavor is sweet and sharp, bitter and sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark brown color with a beige head. Malty aroma with notes of caramel and dried fruits. Flavor is sweet caramel malt, dried fruits, berries, toffee and some chocolate. Smooth and full bodied, warming and sweet aftertaste. Too sweet.

Nice dark brown, generous frothy head. Molasses, chocolate, brown sugar. Very good sweet, thick syrupy, caramel, toffee. Excellent all around. Huzzah!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep dark ruby red color with a big frothy head that fades slowly.  Huge lacing on the glass.  Perfect appearance.  Aroma is rich caramel malt with hints of chocolate, smoke, and booze.  Taste is fairly sweet and incredible smooth.  Thick, chewy, creamy mouthfeel makes it feel like Im drinking a slightly melted milkshake.  The light chocolate and smoke flavors in the finish add something as well.  A really good beer and Im not usually a fan of scotch ales.

Bottle. Dark brown, thickish. Dark caramel, syrup, dried fruit, plums and raidins. A very dark and heavy one. Caramel. Body is thickish, a bit oily, some sweetness. Dark fruits, sweet dark caramel malts.-- bb/h

Bottle 75 cl. Pours dark reddish brown in color with  a thick creamy tanned head. Some more light roasted notes, burnt darker dried fruits and sweet malts in aroma, some burnt wood as well in there. Oily texture and leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Tasty, a bit sweet, some ashy notes but more to the side of some peaty and woody notes. Light smoke and some vanilla even in aftertaste. Smooth and tasty overall.
Bottle from Brewdog shop. Brown color, beige head. Roasty taste with liquorice, coffee, nuts and rum. Extremely well-balanced. Roasty finish with coffee. Excellent brew.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2013 very sweet, syrupy plums grape loads of chocolate dark fruits rich malts gets better as it warms up. Great beer

Bottle, somewhat as pictured but slightly different.  Pours a hazy dark brown, not quite opaque.  Very sweet, lots of grape, plum,, date/fig sweetness.  No real supreme complexity to it, very malty with minimal hops in it.  Awesome example of the style.

750 ml Bottle. Reddish brown colored in appearance with a half-inch of tan foam and bubbles. Aroma is heavy on the toffee, molasses and caramel malt with a bit of rum and dark fruit in the background. The taste is much the same with a fair amount of caramel, chocolate and toasted malt notes upfront followed by some brown sugar, fig and currant to finish it off. Mouthfeel is creamy with medium carbonation and a mildly boozy, smoked finish. The overall flavor is similar to an English style Barley Wine with a little Stout roastiness around the edges. Lots of enjoyable malt flavors to savor throughout each sip.

Tap. Pours dark brown with a medium tan head that leaves nice lacing. Aroma is very malty; toffee, molasses, notes of chocolate. Flavor is about the same plus notes of prune. Medium sweet, lightly bitter with a moderately warming finish hinting at the ABV of the beer.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2012 Smell of nuts and caramel. Dark brown colour, brown head. Aroma of nuts, alcohol.
From bottle. Pours dark with almost no head. Light aroma typical of scotch ales. Great mouthfeel. Tastes wonderfully complex with a lot of malty flavor. A top scotch ale.

750ml bottle from Bierkompass

Pours dark brown with a bubbly light brown head. Aroma of strong sweet syrupy notes, caramel malts, ripe fruits, toffee and hints of berries. Taste is quite malty and sweetish with a lot of syrupy caramel notes, hints of toffee and ripe fruits. Finish is sticky and warming with some caramely toffee notes and hints of hops. Massive and complex beer, but perhaps a bit too sweet for my taste.

Pours dark brown-black with a thick light-beige head. Aroma is cinnamon, apple, spicy, herbal, vanilla and candy. Taste is alcohol, brown sugar, MALT BOMB, touch of skunk, sweet bready finish. Thin lacing. Thin but creamy mouth feel. Nice.

Bottle shared at Beer Temple tasting.  Pours amber brown with a small tan head.  Aroma of caramel, toffee, dark fruits, a little chocolate, raisins.  Flavor is heavy sweet and light bitter.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Sample of a bottle at the beer temple tasting.
Thin tan head.  Sweet malty taste.  Clear amber pour.

Yah, premium beer.  The best scotch ale i have ever had and holds its own across the board, against all styles.  Rich, thick, and almost stout like, but also has qualities of a barleywine, with a nice hop presence and aroma.

Slight fruity and bitter quality to it as well, very complex, and very well done.  Aging is also a good idea, this bottle is over a year old.

Had a taster of this from a bottle @ Beer Temple, generously shared by Louis from Australia, thanks! Deep dark brown color. Not much head. Aromas: caramel/sticky toffee, red fruit (confit). Flavor is medium sweet (not too), fruity. Body is medium, alcohol is quite well hidden. Finishes roasted and medium bitter. Pretty good.

Dark brown with reddish highlights.  Thin brown head, spotty lacing.  Nose is peated malts, raisins, warmed caramel, toffee, and a little chocolate.  Flavor shows the classic peated malts and sweet dark malted notes.  A bit muddled however and the body shows some thinness for the flavor profile.  Semi sweet finish.  Its hard to get behind most scotch ales, and this one is no different.
0.75 l - Creamy, boozy, malty wonderfulness in a tulip glass. Caramel color with light tan head.

Wow, det här var en otroligt bra öl. Ölen är så välbalanserad och rund i smaken att man nästan baxnar. Smaken bär inslag av jäst, rostad malt och knäck. Slutsats: en helt underbar öl som man inte vill sluta dricka.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks zvikar. Pours black with tan head. Wine, musky, velvety chocolate liquor aroma. Sweet lingering taste, a little prune and no bitterness. Full body, velvety texture, long finish. I love it.
Awesome sweet peaty aromas. Malty sweet delicious flavors. Overall a very good wee heavy.

Bottle at home from brewdog online. Sweet Turkish delight and slight solvent in the nose, thick, gentle carbonation sweet and heavy. High alcohol level v noticeable and has the solvent flavours i associate with candy sugar in dubbels..must be the molasses. Not a fan but well made.

scotch ale blind tasting session. thanks to tom10101! almost clear very dark brown with a nice beige head, good retention and lacing. lightly smoked, raisins, dark complex roasted malts, peppery, hint of sweetness. soft carbonation, full body, very nice grassy-lightly resinous finish. great brew!

Bottle. Blind tasting.
Pours brown with low beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is of  caramel, alcohol, spices. taste is sweet, caramel, alcohol, sligthy aicd, bitterness. Palate: good body. Overall: Pretty good Scotch Ale, though not my favorite style.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle at home. Pours a hazy dark cola with a tan head and significant lacing. Raisins and caramel in the nose.  Quite full carbonation in the mouthfeel.  Sweet  dark fruits, roasted malts, hints of chocolate and coffee. Quite lovely.
quasoi scura con riflessi rossastri schiuma media fine persistente note tostate toffee maltate buon corpo discreta beva leggero warming piuttosto bilanciata leggero afumicato finale lungo complesso

Bottle (750 ml). Deep brown/mahogany with a small fully lasting beige head and good lacing. Aroma is rich with malt/caramel, toffee and hints of smoked/peated malt. Taste is sweet and rich with caramel and toffee. Theres also a slight dark chocolate finish and hints of smoke and peat. Mouthfeel is thick for a Scotch Ale. Its sugary, but not overwhelming. Incredible balance which make it quite drinkable for the style. I was a little disappointed by the complexity of the beer since I had so high hopes for this beer, but its still a great luscious Scotch Ale.

Tasted in a blind Scotch Ale tasting on october 13th 2012 (my ranking in parenthesis): Rank # 1: Le Bilboquet MacKroken fût de chêne (# 3) # 2: Alesmith Wee Heavy (# 1) # 3: Cigar City Big Sound (# 2) # 4: À la Fût Corne de Brume (# 5) # 5: Dieu du Ciel Équinoxe du Printemps (# 4) # 6: Founders Dirty Bastard (# 6) # 7: Glazen Toren Canaster Winterscotch (# 7)

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2014 Re-rate 4/14: Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks YK23 & eyes_wide_shut. Dark brown with a big tan head. Aroma of roastiness, malt, cookies, chocolate, a peaty touch and some dark fruits notes. Sweet malty flavor with chocolate, some roasty notes, some dark fruits, caramel, a bit of brown sugar hints, a smoky hint and a touch of alcohol in the finish. Quite full-bodied. 8/4/7/4/15=3.8

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks zvikar. Dark brown color with a beige head. Great aroma full of dark chocolate, pralines, cocoa and a bit of dark fruits. Sweet malty flavor with chocolate, some nuts, caramel, dark fruits, liqueur notes, a bit of alcohol and a finish with licorice notes. Full-bodied. Great stuff. 8/3/8/4/16=3.9

Bottle from Systembolaget. Sweet malty smell with some dried fruit. Similar taste with a light roasted bitterness. Dark malty with rye bread. Leaves a taste in your moth of recently boiled wort. Nice to sip at.

Dark brown pour, beige head.  Malty, licorice, and some caramel on nose.  Taste is malty, light on the peat.  Very good stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Appellation Wines - thanks Ash. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Smell is sweet, fruity and malty with caramel, liqourice alcohol, rye bread, and chocolate. Taste is sweet with more liqourice and chocolate, fruits and caramel. Palate is medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and fruity and long. Very nice beer!

Dark, brownish red pour with a frothy tan head.  The aroma is woody with caramel and light chocolate.  It has a medium, smooth body with average carbonation.  The taste is smokey with some warmth and a roasted finish.

Bomber from Ølbutikken. Pours dark mahogany with a small tanned head leaving small laces. Aroma is sweet raisins earthy malty toasted nutty fruity. Flavor is malty bready nutty fruity molassis slightly alcohol toasted some raisins nice bitterness, nice indeed. Finishes a bit flat bitter malty.

Pours a mahogany color with a dense tan head.  Aroma of sweet, dark fruits such as raisins and plums.  A mild roasted malt character, a hint of peat, and lots of toffee and toasted bread.  Just a touch of alcohol, too.  The flavor has a nice note of banana to go along with the raisin, plum, and black cherry.  A hint of peat, some roasted notes, and a lot of caramel, toffee, and toast.
Pours dark brown with cream colored head and good lace. Aroma malts, yeast, alcohol. Taste sweet malts, molasses, dark chocolate, caramel,slight alcohol. Full body long sweet and dry malt finish.

Classy beer this. Aroma is some wood with a touch of vanilla and roasted malts and sweet dark fruit, reminiscent of aged rum. High notes from the alcohol pop in at the top end. In the mouth, the blurbs choice of chewy is apposite. Stick and rounded malt with the classic sweetness of a wee heavy, some smoke in there, but with great smoothness and subtleness, finish is long and oily with dark fruit sweetness married to a touch of refreshing bitterness. Can become a little cloying at times, but thats to be expected. Good stuff!

Bottle 5 Beer tasting club - First Scotch ale I have had so didnt know what to expect, but what a way to start. Pours a deep amber colour, flavour of rich malts.  The level of carbonation gives it a pleasing mouth feel.  Nice need to try more Scotch Ales.

750mL bottle. Pours a dark amber brown with a large tan head. Smells of wood, vanilla, scotch, oak, caramel, and chocolate. Flavor is a subtle mixture of smells -- predominantly dark chocolate, oak wood, earthy notes, and a hint of whiskey. There is also a note of caramel malt in the background, which comes out as a large part of the finish, and passing notes of smoke and dryness. Always smooth and never overbearing; very subtle -- not in your face at all. Palate is smooth, medium thick, but not overly potent. Great balance. Very smooth. A very good beer.

Ar: jam, roastiness, honey, molasses, yeastiness, coffee, ash, dried fruits, alcohol.
Ap: Ruby colour, creamy tan head, lacing.
F: boozy, overpowering alcohol, roastiness, jam, dried fruit, coffee and chocolate. Alcohol needs time to mellow down, right now its way to prominent.
M: soft carbonation, considering ABV not very full bodied.
T: When you pay around 25 $ for a beer you expect it to be better than this.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2013 Dark brown with massive, creamy, foamy, fine-bubbled beige head / Rich, sweet nose of maple syrup, dark fresh caramel, root beer, tobacco, dark fruit / Mostly fully body, sweet & syrupy, lively carbonation, noticeable alcohol kick which unduly thins out the body, some hop balance and bitterness lurking underneath / Sweet, complex flavors of date, fig, raisin, brown sugar, semisweet chocolate, nuts, smoke / I think the body could be a little fuller, or the alcohol toned down some, but I nitpick.  Great stuff.

Aroma: Smelling of fudge, butter scotch, dried dates, apricots, Marzipan, almonds and Sherry.Appearance: The brew is clear deep chestnut, has a dark tan head that settles slowly leaving good lacing and having good curtains.Taste: Tasting of sweet brown bread, dark dried fruits, Sherry and almonds.Palate: Medium carbonation, soft and oily, a huge body. A very smooth dryness.Overall: In small portions, mostly after dinner, with a good dessert, why not Crème Brûlée.Note: Bottle 750 ml. Reviewed 2012-09-05.

pours a cloudy maroon with a large tan head, and great lacing.

smell is of malt, some brown sugar, spice, nuts, and butterscotch.

taste is creamy, roastiness, malt, some hops, and a tad sweet.  ends dry and slightly bitter.

Flaske delt med (alt for mange) ølvenner hos Sigmund, juni-11: har ennå til gode å prøve et uinteressant øl fra Alesmith, og dette må jeg bare prøve på nytt ved første anledning.Money (almost) no object.

Pours a clear but very deep and dark brown, with a massive and frothy light tan head. Aroma has quite a bit of alcohol, but also dark fruit (prune, raisin), toasty malt, a hint of chocolate. Taste has a slight initial bitterness with an alcohol backbone, then turns sweeter with a fairly thick chocolatey flavor and a sort of dry woody character. Finish is long with a fairly mellow alcohol bitterness and a deeper, fuller touch of chocolate malt. Body is medium and creamy with low carbonation. Scotch ale is certainly not my favorite style, but this beer has done a lot to win me over!

Pours dark dark brown with low off white head
Aromas of fudge, honey, resin, oak
Low carbonated. Creamy, round, sweet. Great taste from caramel malts, chocolate malts and molasses!
Pours very dark red with a high tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee and alcohol. Flavor is roasted malts, caramel, some yeast and alcohol. Sublime.

Bottle.
Dark reddish brown with a large beige head.
Aroma: malty, light chocolate, quite sweet, with marmalade candy if that is what they are called.
Taste: large maltiness, dried fruits, brown sugar, toffee, light earthy, a hint of licorice, light chocolate, light smoke.
Full-bodied, smooth.
A nice, well balanced, malt-heavy brew.
Bottle. Dark red colour, almost black, with a light tan head. Sweet caramel aroma. Heavy malt, caramel, yeast flavour.

750 ml bottle. Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Finland.
Dark reddish brown colour with tiny tan head.
Dark fruits, plums, raisins, sugar and 
Flavour is chocolate, dark fruits, very much sugary sweetness and robust maltiness. Alcohol presence is evident. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled:Deep, reddish brown colour. Small head. Aroma is toffee, chocolate and salty licorice. Smooth, malty flavour of toffee, chocolate and salty licorice. Bitter, somewhat boozy finish.

A clear dark brown colored beer, with a beige head. The aroma of dark fruits with hops and a little alcohol. The taste of sweet malt, a little bitter fruits with alcohol notes. There are coffee and chocolate notes. The aftertaste is some sweet, with biter notes and alcohol.

75cl bottle. Pours chestnut brown with a red hue. The nose has nuts, chocolate and a bit of dried fruits. As you persist, theres a kirsch note, then tiffin or tirimasu. The taste has coffee, cream and more of that kirsch note with dry liquorice on the end. The palate is rich in body with a big creamy texture and a long but slightly too sweet finish. Beautiful liqueur beer.
smells and tastes of malt and caramel. Great example of of a Scotch Ale and a great job by this brewery. Can not wait to try more by AleSmith

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 750 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours dark reddish brown with a big frothy and creamy goldenish beige head that slowly dissipates leaving lots of lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet, tiny sour, fruity and malty with caramel, wood, alcohol, dark grapes, sweet dark bread, prunes, toffee, vanilla fudge, burnt sugar, dark chocolate, liquorice candy, moist tobacco and hints of smoke. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter, tiny sour, malty and fruity with caramel, dark grapes, resinous wood, vanilla, moist tobacco, cocoa powder, dark honey, toffee, caramelized almonds, dark bread, sweet liquorice candy, brown sugar, moist soil and hints of smoke and peat. Mouthfeel is rich, round, slightly boozy, slightly vinous, slightly sticky sweet and full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, tiny bitter and fruity with sweet dark bread, dark grapes, burnt caramel, resinous wood, vanilla fudge, peat, chocolate, toffee and dark golden syrup. Very rich and very nice...
Amazing scent. I enjoyed tasting the caramel, chocolate, and roasted malts. Alesmith did it again. The sweetness in the scent mimics the taste. Im impressed  and will have this again.

Olut kaatuu lasiin tumman ruskeana ja punertavana, kauniina lasin beigen värisellä vaahdolla kuorruttavana notkeana nesteenä. Tuoksussa on karamellia, ripaus suklaata, kaakaota, paahtunutta mallasta ja siikavelliä. Maultaan tämä kummallinen, hyvin tyypillisen pullomaisen pakkauksen tuote on paahtunut, makea, maltainen ja kitkeryydeltään tumman suklainen. Pikkuisen on kaakaota seassa. Hyvin on pehmeää ja mukavan liukasta. Silti vähähiilihapokasta ja runsaan pyöreää. Mielenkiintoinen olut, tyypissään tosin normaalin vivahteikas.

750ml bottle. Dark with a ruby glint. Great head retention. Nice aroma of toasted caramel, dark fruit, coffee, wood and liquorice. Everything I expected from a wee heavy. The taste lives up to my expectations too, with a great mixture of fruit and caramel carried by a creamy mouthfeel. Even some occasional throat burn cant detract from this excellent creation. Really good stuff.

75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100701.
Pours clear deep dark amber, almost mahogany color with medium off-white head. Aroma of sweet caramel, toffee, sweetish malts, mild yeast, dark ripe fruits and some wooden notes. Some slight alcohol burn on the nose at the end. Flavor of caramel malts, toffee, ripe fruits, mild syrup, some chocolate, sugar candy and some liquorice notes. Hints of tar and yeast notes can be found as well. Creamy and a bit sticky palate, full-bodied and smooth, warming alcohol on the finish. Quite complex and slow-drinking brew. Excellent.
6427

Bottle.  Pours dark reddish brown with a small beige head.  Sweet malty aroma with notes of caramel and dried fruits.  Moderately sweet flavor with notes of caramel, dried fruits, light smoke and a light hop bitterness.  Sweet but smooth finish.  Tasty but a little sweet for my taste.

75 cl bottle from Bierkompass.de cons 2012-08-04 and shared with family at the BBQ Karlskoga
AP: dark ruby red colored body, frothy thick beige head, lovely lacings
AR/F: scottish butter fudge, dark milk chocolate, warmfeeeling, fizzy, medium bitterness, grainy

Bomber aged for 2 years. Pours dark brown with thick tan head.  Aroma is caramel and chocolate. Flavor is caramel, chocolate, slight smokiness, and some earthiness. Very nice; would love to try the barrel-aged version of it.

750 ml bottle. Orange brown with a lacy head. Rich caramel nose, chewy raisins and figs. Nice malt. Chewy malt, cherry, raisin, caramel. Nice tart edge, plus decent hop finish. Tasty, neither too sweet not too thick. Very nicely drinkable.
Crazy fruity roasted malts aroma. Very dark brown appearance with nice white head. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, fruit. Tasty.
What a complex beer. Lots going on. Scotchy, boozy smell. Tobacco, sweet aromas. Candy. Lots of peaty scotchy flavours. Lingering warmth. Some spiciness....big flavours. Love it.
Lovely beer. Very dark ruby pour. Malty, fruity nose. The flavor is a complex layering of roasted malts, coffee, dark fruit, and a slight alcohol warming at the end. Thick body.

This beer appears a dark brown color, with a medium-sized, sandy colored head and a fair mount of lacing. The aroma is definitely indicative of a Scotch ale. The beer tastes pretty good, and has a nice sweet malt character. Alesmith Wee Heavy is a pretty straight forward brew. I didnt find a lot of intricacies or intriguing flavors here, just a basic, plain Scotch Ale. There is a noticeable warming alcohol note in the finish, though not overpowering. Despite the lack of complexity, I thought this was a decent beer, and pretty drinkable, especially given the 10% abv. Overall, a good offering, though certainly not my favorite representation of the style.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2012 On bottle at Olympen.
Dark/ reddish color, some foam. Medium carbonation.
Aromas of chocolate , malt & dried fruits.
Full body & high complexity.
Well balanced & very enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at the brewery. Deep brown liquid with small to medium, off-white to tan head. Aroma of caramel, raw sugar, biscuit, dark fruit and fruity yeast. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of caramel and fruity yeast. Full bodied with medium carbonation.
Bottle. Pours a sun rise amber with fluffy morning cloud head. Aroma of fresh baked biscuits and honey. Taste is super malty creamy with hint of smoke. My favorite scotch ale

750 ml bottle.
Pours a deep, beautiful amber colour with a small creamy white head. Aroma of sweet malts at first, then sweet raisins, wood and caramel. Rich flavour of sweet, quite heavy malts, toffee, nuts, sweet raisins, molasses, ripe apricot and wood. Complex. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel and a long, warming finish with sweetness and some delicate apricot again. Really enjoyable. AleSmith is great at these kind of beers.

[4408-20120504] 750mL bottle. Metallic nutty roast date malt aroma. Murky, dark brown body with a quick creamy mocha tan head. Lightly nutty roasted malt flavour has a sweet toffee finish. Full body. Great, seems overly mellow. (7/4-/7/4/14) 3.6
Overheard: "Come in and de-sweatify."
(c/o HogTownHarry, w/ him, blankboy, garthicus, GregClow, jerc)

Bread, caramel, molasses and some nut in the aroma.  More of the same in the flavor, with some spice, alcohol, and a little hop bitterness in the finish for balance.  Somewhat watery mouthfeel.  Certainly a good beer, but I was expecting more based on the rating.

Thanks to Dixonian for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a brownish color with a tan head. The aroma is heavy on the peat smoke, with some toffee and caramel malt thrown in. The flavor is a bit more complex. I get some nice toffee and dark fruit notes, along with a hint of peat smoke and some light alcohol notes. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. A very nice Scotch ale, glad I got to try this one.

Pours a dark mahogany brown, with ample, thick head. Aroma is chocolate, alcohol, raisins. Mouth feel almost velvety smooth, but with moderate carbonation. Flavor is subtle malt, roasted grain, bit of sour cherries, and balancing hops. Not really sweet. There is a certain sour tone in this that Im not so sure about. Unexpected. Slight lingering bitterness and sour finish. Not bad, but doesnt quite grab my attention as I was hoping. Might do interesting things if cellared.

You can see as this beer is poured into your selected glass, that it has a deep chestnut red color but the end result has a look of deeper brown. Ruby high lights pour into view along the edges. The foamy tan cap is smallish but quite dense with a long retention, leaving long lacing about the glass.

Aromatics are rich sweet malts, some roasted malts and maybe hints of burnt toffee. As the beer warms the aromas mingle nicely releasing some more flavors such as candied sugars and molasess.
Possibly some peat but that could be suggestive I think.

Very malt forwar brew here.
As the beer warms flavors come and go, there is alot going on here. At the first sip you taste the rich malts toffee and roasted malts. But as the beer warms other flavors become apparent like candied sugar, dark fruits. The end ends with warming alcohol, quite strong.

A rather thick beer with a smooth mouthfeel. Smooth and creamy as it warms further. The alcohol also become more intense as it warms.

A good beer to sip along with through the night but I do feel that the alcohol is a bit stong for me. Perhaps if this ale was toned down abit it would excel even further.
Bottle. Pours a solid murky dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of molasses, treacle, and roasted malts. Flavour the same including liquorice or anise, and coffee. Full bodied, really nice
Brown pour with dense tan head. Lots of carbonation Roasted nose Raisins, Dark Fruits, Roasted Malts. Sweet. Medium bodied.  Bitter Roasty finish. Lovely. My words dont do it justice

750ml Bottle.  Pours a thick dark black with a hint of brown, two finger caramel head, dissapates to a thicker ring, splatter lacing.  Smell is rich caramel, malt balls, vanilla, cooked brown sugar.  Taste is more sugary malts, toffee, some distant chocolate and coffee, just a bit of smoke.  Full and creamy mouthfeel.  Very, very nice beer.  Almost resembles some aspects of barrel aging.
Dark brown color with a cream colored thin head. Aroma of sweet caramel, slight smokey bourbon, bit of hops underneath. Heavily sweet flavor. Very rich and creamy. Delicious!

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2012 Shared 750 ml bottle @ Cosmic Comic Cafe. Pours a deep, dark red with a small, thick, yellowish-brown head. Aroma is sweet with malt flavors up front: Toffee and caramel, some pith there as well. Ethanol is detectable too though not disturbingly so. Taste is sweet with toffee, caramel, toffee and chocolatey caramel. Some pine an pith there as well, but they play a rather small part. Palate is sticky and full.

Bottle from bu11zeye, thanks! Murky mahogany with a medium brownish head.  Aroma of licorice, toffee, malt and a hint of smoke.  Taste of toffee, liquid sugar, malt, brown sugar and alcohol.  Sweet with a semi-dry finish.  This one was just too sweet for me.

Location/Date:Bottle onMay 24th, 2012.
Appearance: Pours a dark brown cloud with faint brown "sand" 
Aroma: Aroma of malty caramel.
Taste: Light bitterness, a lot of caramel..
Palate:Medium body, slightly slick.
Summary: Tasty, even at 1 year old.

Best Scotch Ale I have had.  Bottle aged about 18 months.  Pours dark brown but still translucent with slight cream head and minimal carbonation.  Mouthfeel is the first thing I noticed; this is thick for a scotch ale, creamy in texture.  Flavor is slightly boozy, lots of caramel, some nuttyness and a sugary finish.  Great sipper, improves as it gets warmer.

Bottle from Healthy Spirits in San Francisco. Thick dark brown pour with a huge creamy head. Sweet malt and molasses aroma. Full creamy palate. Taste is rich caramel malt, some smoke, sweet molasses - absolutely delicious.

Pours a nice clean brown with off white head. Once of the better Scotch Ales Ive had, but short of legendary due to a lack of complexity. Nose and taste are smoky, malty, a touch of bread, not a sweet as expected. Well balanced and certainly worth drinking again.
About as perfect as beers get.  Toasty, warming, nice bourbon taste.  Little bite of smoke at the end is a nice finish.  So malty that it could be confused with a barley wine.  Fantastic!
Aroma is roasts sweet dark fruits.  Very tasty malty with good mouthfeel.

Bottle purchased in Dec 2009. Pours a very deep brown with amber edges and a creamy light tan head, nice lacing. Aroma is rich molasses, caramel, cocoa, a bit woody, brown sugar, nutty. Flavor has much the same, some malt oxidation though which is sitting nicely in this beer. more of the cocoa coming out with notes of smoke, lots of nuttiness, a hint of alcohol which fits nicely with the woody notes. Finishes smooth and creamy, barely any bitterness. Medium full to full slightly sticky body and a soft carbonation. Great beer

Very deep brown in color with a hint of red. A somewhat small light brown head. Strong. A bit of chocolate, cherry, whiskey, smoke, caramel, and malt. A bit creamy, but not too thick. Overall, I am usually not a fan of the style but this one is a standout for sure.

Incredible! Packed win flavor, chocolate aromas with a hint of whiskey or berry. Taste is rich, smooth, robust, deep, strong, balanced, molasses. Top of the line. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a dark ruby color with a beige head and good lacing. Aroma of dark fruits and chocolate. Taste is combination of plums, peach, raisin, chocolate and caramel. Finishes a bit smoky. Very smooth.
Pours deep brown with cocoa head.  Nose is sweet with syrup notes.  Smooth on the tongue with caramel and brown sugar out front moving to slight bourbon, molasses and slight alcohol burn.  Delicious.

Pours deep reddish brown with little tan head.  Aromas of caramel, alcohol, and roastiness.  Taste is sweet with slight alcohol burn.  I do get a bit of smokey taste, but also some notes of raisin.  Full bodied, fairly flat, and nice moderate bitterness on the back end.  Overall, this is a big beer, and has the flavor to back it up.  A true sipping beer for me.

750ml bottle, shared with friends. Nice, persisting tan head. Half-hazy dark brown / red color. Lighter, softer carbonation. Smooth and dry texture. Nice, sweet taste, bit of warmth, little bitter. Good caramel malty scotchy aroma, dark fruit. Pretty tasty.
Dark amber/brown with a white head - good dark malt aroma - good solid dark malt body with some sweetness - lingering malt finish - this was very good

Mohagany pour with a tan head. Aroma is smoked malt. Taste is smoked malt, creamy,very smooth, nice malty flavor. Nice smoke aftertaste in the mouth. As it warms , the flavor intensifies. Nice lacing,
Bottle. Dark brown, lighter head. Malts, caramel, dark and red fruit, wine?, not much bitterness, medium body, slick mouthfeel.
Yet another of my all time favorites. thick black pour, with a creamy half finger head. Smooth milky chocolate aroma. Easy drinking roasty and chocolatey flavor.
290311: Delicious creamy dark ale. Smoky flavors it says on the label - where is it?. Sweet and strong as a Belgian, only more dark malty.

Deep brown with a white head. Aroma is bananas and a little dark fruit. Flavor is sweet with some banana notes. Finish is a slightly smokey malt. Some very slight hops present underneath. Solid scotch ale, if a little sticky sweet.
Bomber. An excellent Scotch Ale. Tastes of sweet dark fruit, chocolate and cherry. Mild alcohol burn throughout. Smooth drinking. A light bitterness to the finish. Tasty.
Bottle.  Pours a deep brown with medium head.  The flavor is caramel malty sweet.  Very smooth and easy to drink.  You dont notice the high alcohol content.  Pretty good overall.

Bottle pours a dark brown tint of red in light with a off white head. Smells and tastes of  chocolate, floral, alcohol, soy sauce, darker fruit. Has almost a dry red wine finish diff from a lot of scotch ales ive had in the past. Not as sweet more dry.light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, theres a lot to this beer that leaves you thinking while drinking it. Doesnt come off like you would expect I am just getting over a cold would like to try this again with a fresher nose and taste buds. I like it.

Ive had this one for a while. Aroma consists of chocolate, ash, cinnamon, some red fruit, alcohol (brandy-like), raisins, and a bit of soy. Overall, this one is intense in aromas with some different notes coming out as it warms. Pour wise, this one is dark brown with a light brown head. Taste is chocolate, molasses, cherries, alcohol, some caramel, and a bit of port wine. This is an intense and flavorful brew. I think this is my favorite of the style so far. Awesome!

Thanks to OmegaX for this unique brew. With a deep brown body and off-whtie head - it was very dark for a scotch ale. Id say the scent was reminiscent of others of this style, but this one had lots of chocolate and cherries in the mix - thick too. Flavors were mainly molasses and alcohol, with a profound cocoa body with a hint of hops for a bitter finish. The mouth-feel was rich and creamy as well - making the perfect sipper overall. Yay.

Angenehm süßer und voller malzliköriger Geruch; Holzfass. Süßmalziger Antrunk. Mitte bietet ausgewogen viel Schokolade, dunkles Malz und eine gewisse trockene Herbe. Abgangs wieder süß, likörig mit erdigen Tönen. Holzig-trocken und likörbrandig nachhallend. Super!

Purchased at Hyde Park Wine & Spirits in Cincinnati, OH...about 6 months ago, enjoyed at a good friends house while watching the newest versions of the show "An Idiot Abroad".  Appearance very very dark, clearish brown with rich off white head that laces to the glass.  Aroma is extremely potent, huge malt notes, also the alcohol appears prevalent in the mix, unique malt scent, not really caramel.  Taste is nice, smooth, but packs a punch.  Really nice, flavorful brew.  Mostly malty but has a nice bitterness, very slightly nutty.  Also a bit sweet/dark fruit.  Possibly best scotch ale Ive had.
Very nice dark brown pour with dark brown head. Aroma is subtle; caramel and nuts? Flavor is chocolate, caramel, nuts, raisins, and maybe a little vanilla. YUM. Round, creamy, and full.

Pours a clear but dark mahogany with a thing beige cap, looks like its going to taste awesome. The aroma is smokey, oak, molasses and chocolate are prominent, some dark fruits, big on raisins, dates, maybe a hint of ripe cherries, reminds me of a bit of Harviestoun Ola Dubh but better, smells like its going to taste awesome. The flavour. .. . is awesome, starts out with some chewy molasses, bit of anise, semi sweet chocolate shows up mid way through the show and melts away into a medley of raisens and a sort of bitter black licorice note, finishs on a salty black licorice note that trails off into infinity. awesome. Mouth feel is full and chewy, carries the flavours across the tongue perfectly.

Appears very dark brown, and I can see some cloudiness near the bottom of the glass. Head is tan and is not too big. Aroma is very lifted, smells like chocolate liqueur, wood and molasses. This taste BIG! Brown sugar, toasted brioche, smoked wood and dark chocolate with black cherry flavors come through to me. The finish is very warm, woody, smokey, and a touch of sweetness. Beautiful warm after taste that lingers on and on, but invites you back for more. This is great!
There is a dark maroon color and a thin tan bubbly head. The aroma is extremely intense of oak, vanilla. Medium weight on a the palate and creamy.

(bottle).  Pours espresso brown with  tan head and minimal lacing. The aroma is intense with sweet dried fruits and rum.  The flavor is very rich with sweet malts, alcohol and dried fruit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark Chestnut ruby red color with foamy head that withdraws to a ring on my pint glass; aroma not too striking but the palate and taste is quite impressive, malt bomb with hops in background but noticeable; complex beer with notes of molasses, fig, rye bread, dark chocolate and cherry to name a few; very solid double Scottish ale

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Holy hell!! I can see how this brew sets a standard. This is my 1st from this brewery and I now see why its rated so high. Deep mahogany pour with a thick tan head. Big aromas. Sweet malt, peaty smoke, vanilla and molasses. Complex flavors. Raisins, caramel, chocolate, toffee. When it warms it changes nicely. Complex.  Smoky peat, vanilla, oak chips and figs. I also pick up a tad of bitterness, dont know where with all the flavors, toward the finish... Mouthfeel is chewy, full body. I pickup the ABV but its a young bottle. This stuff is wonderful with every sip. Savor slowly. I may not bother ever trying another scotch ale again, dont think anything could top this!  $10.99 for a 750 ml bottle @ Julios.
Bottle shared with beerboxer. Dark brown red in the light.. taste like a toasted malt oak. Best scotch ale ive had.

Dear sweet jesus this is good.  Makes Kilt Lifter seem like Corona Light.  Huge bodied caramel malt bomb with a healthy bitterness on the finish.  The aroma is the only thing I found lacking... although it adds to the surprise of the hugeness of this beer.  Best Scotch Ale I have had to date.

Pours a medium to deep brown brew, a small medium tan head that leaves a ring and a bit of spotty lacing. Killer aroma! Big caramel, sweet!, molasses, nuts, plum, toffee, almond, white chocolate, red licorice and roasted malts. Smelling this made me drool many times. Lots of roast in the taste, fruit cake, toffee, light spice, chocolate, pepper, plum and lots of things. Smooth with no real notice of the 10%. A treat of a beer.

Bottle @ home. Dark reddish brown appearance with a sizable, brown head. Sweet dark fruity, molasses, chocolate, dark malty, toffee aroma. Rich dark fruity (plum, raspberry, blackberry), toffee, chocolate, somewhat roasty dark malty, dark caramel, a touch woody flavor with a warming, slightly boozy, caramel, dark chocolate finish.

Bottle. Ah, finally - one of the Kings of Scotch. Been looking forward to this for a while. :-) Pours a near-black, ruby-toned body with a big off-white head. Aroma is toffee, deep malts, caramel and hints of burnt almonds and raisins. Very nice. Taste goes on: nuts, caramel, toffee, raisins and hints of burnt sugar and alcohol in a highly integrated fashion. Smooth, near-slick mouthfeel. AleSmith does it again; this is an ale of superior smoothness and the craftsmanship is impeccable. A great and not just wee heavy beer.
